[[Lumpenproletariat]]

CATEGORIES: Marxism, Social groups

In Marxism, the Lumpenproletariat ("rag-proletariat" in German) is class of people who are at lowest level of society and do not have class consciousness (awareness about their place in the class struggle). Generally they are unemployable or are criminals.

Some left-wing activists believe that the lumpenproletariat the "most exploited" class of people and therefore the most revolutionary, but others think that they cannot be organized into revolutionary forces and are more likely to be paid agents who are hired to stop revolution.

[[Evermore (Taylor Swift album)]]

CATEGORIES: 2020 albums, Taylor Swift

Evermore (styled in lowercase) is the eighth studio album by American recording artist Taylor Swift. It was released on December 11, 2020, as a "sister" album to her previous record, Folklore, which was released just a few months prior. It was produced by Swift, Aaron Dessner, Bryce Dessner, and Jack Antonoff.

Evermore became Swift's seventh US number-one album, earning 329,000 units there in its first week. Its lead single, "Willow", became her seventh Billboard Hot 100 number-one song. Its music video was released the same day as the album.

[[Trafficking of children]]

CATEGORIES: Child abuse, Slavery

Trafficking of children is a form of human trafficking: Violence and threats are used to recruit them, or they are kidnapped.  They are then trafficked. 

[[Forced marriage]]

CATEGORIES: Marriage

A forced marriage is a marriage which happens against the will of one or both partners. A forced marriage is different from an arranged marriage: In an arranged marriage, the parents or other third parties will help finding a suitable partner.

International human rights law including International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights also prohibit unfree marriage without consent of each person. 

[[Kepler-69c]]

Kepler-69c is an uninhabitable exoplanet. It orbits Kepler-69 at 0.64 AU.

[[Base and superstructure]]

CATEGORIES: Marxism, Society

According to Marxism, society is made up of the base (substructure) and the superstructure. These two parts influence each other.

[[Jakku]]

CATEGORIES: Star Wars planets

Jakku is a desert planet from Star Wars. The planet first appeared in Star Wars: The Force Awakens, the first installment in the Star Wars sequel trilogy. Jakku is very sparsely populated because of its harsh climate. After the Battle of Endor, Jakku was the sight of a big battle between the remaining Imperial fleet and the newly formed New Republic fleet. As soldiers fought each other in the desert and dogfights took place above, the large cruisers from the fleets started to drag each other to the surface of the planet with their tractor beams. Ships crashed to surface causing a "graveyard" of ships to form. The Republic fleet won the battle and the remaining Imperial forces fled into the unknown regions of the galaxy. Rey Skywalker is from Jakku and helped Finn escape the planet with BB-8 after the First Order massacred a village and started to look for Finn, after he deserted. A year later the people of Jakku rose up against the First Order as part of a galaxy wide rebellion after the Battle of Exegol in Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker.

[[NARAL Pro-Choice America]]

CATEGORIES: Non-profit organizations of the United States, 1969 establishments in the United States

NARAL Pro-Choice America, or just NARAL, is an American non-profit organization. It is a 501(c)(4) group. It engages in lobbying and political action. It also works to go against restrictions on abortion and expand access to it, birth control, paid parental leave and pregnancy discriminations.

NARAL is associated with the NARAL Pro-Choice America Foundation, a 501(c)(3) organization. They're also associated with the NARAL Pro-Choice America PAC, a political action committee. 

NARAL was founded in 1969. It is the oldest abortion rights advocacy group in the United States.

[[IG-88]]

CATEGORIES: Fictional characters introduced in the 1980s, Star Wars characters

IG-88 is a bounty hunter and assassin droid from Star Wars. He first appeared in  1980s, Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back and has gone on to appear in Star Wars Forces of Destiny and some comics. IG-88 was present with other bounty hunters including Bossk and Boba Fett when Darth Vader gave them a task to capture the Millennium Falcon. His head was made out of recycled props from Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope. IG-88 is voiced by Matthew Wood in Forces of Destiny.

[[Papurana]]

CATEGORIES: Frogs, Animals of Australia, Animals of Oceania

Papurana is a genus of frogs in the family Ranidae, "true frogs." They live in New Guinea, some islands near New Guinea, and in northern Australia. Papurana daemeli is the only frog in Ranidae that lives in Australia.

[[Bossk]]

CATEGORIES: Star Wars characters

Bossk was a male Trandoshan bounty hunter from Star Wars. He first appeared in Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back on Darth Vader's flagship with other bounty hunters. Vader tasked the bounty hunters with finding the Millennium Falcon which Boba Fett ended up finding. Bossk is also seen in the background in Star Wars Episode VI: Return of the Jedi. Like the rest of his species, Bossk has a hatred for Wookiees and a personal hatred for Chewbacca. Bossk also appears in Star Wars: The Clone Wars where he helps a young Boba Fett learn the ways of bounty hunting with other bounty hunters. Bossk has also appeared in many books and comics. In the novel, Ezra's Gamble Bossk and Ezra Bridger work together to expose a corrupt Imperial officer.

[[Trandoshan]]

CATEGORIES: Star Wars species

Trandoshans were a reptilian like species from Star Wars. They hail from the planet Trandosha and have a keen sense of smell. Trandoshans are a warlike species and have a natural rivalry with the neighboring Wookiees often hunting them. The most well known Trandoshan is the bounty hunter Bossk who has appeared in multiple Star Wars films and other media.

[[Tralee]]

CATEGORIES: County towns in Ireland, County Kerry

Tralee (t tra; Trá Lí, t̪ˠɾˠaː ˈl̠ʲiː, formerly Tráigh Lí, t̪ˠɾˠæːj ˈl̠ʲiː, meaning 'strand of the Lee River') is the county town of County Kerry, Ireland. 

[[Munster Technological University]]

CATEGORIES: 21st century establishments in the Republic of Ireland, 2020s establishments in Europe, 2021 establishments, Colleges and universities in Europe, Buildings and structures in Ireland

Munster Technological University (Ollscoil Teicneolaíochta na Mumhan) or MTU is a technological university (TU). It is in Cork and Tralee in Ireland. It was opened on 1 January 2021. 

Both institutes of technology, Cork Institute of Technology and IT Tralee were merged together to make MTU. 

[[Aaron Neville]]

CATEGORIES: 1941 births, African-American singers, American R&B musicians, American soul musicians, Singers from New Orleans, Louisiana, Living people

Aaron Neville (born January 24, 1941) is an American R&B and soul music singer. He has had four platinum studio albums and four Top 10 hits in the United States. Three songs hit #1 on the Billboard's Adult Contemporary chart.

Neville is the uncle of Fox News and television personality Arthel Neville.

Neville was born in New Orleans, Louisiana.

[[Gala]]

CATEGORIES: Apples

Gala is a variety of eating  and  cooking apple.  This variety is crisp, juicy and sweet.  It has a red skin that can have some additional yellow color.  The gala apple was created in New Zealand by crossing  Kidd’s orange red and golden delicious apples.

https://usapple.org/apple-variety/gala

In the United States, it was projected in 2019 to be the most highly produced apple variety.

[[Connie Smith]]

CATEGORIES: 1941 births, Singers from Indiana, Singers from Cincinnati, Ohio, Singers from West Virginia, American country singers, Living people, People from Elkhart, Indiana

Constance June Meador (also known as Connie Smith; born August 14, 1941) is an American singer. Her contralto vocals have been described by music writers as significant and influential to the women of country music. A similarity has been noted between her vocal style and that of Patsy Cline. 

Smith was discovered in 1963. She signed with RCA Victor Records in 1964. She remained with the label until 1973. Her first single "Once a Day" hit #1 on the Billboard Hot Country Songs chart in November 1964. It was at the top position for eight weeks. "Once a Day" became Smith's biggest hit.

Smith was nominated at the Grammy Awards for Best Female Country Vocal Performance.

Smith's success continued with another 19 top-ten hits during the 1960s and 1970s. Those included "Ain't Had No Lovin'", "Cincinnati, Ohio" and "I Never Once Stopped Loving You."

Smith was nominated for eleven Grammy Awards.

Smith was born in Elkhart, Indiana. She later lived in West Virginia and Ohio.

[[Calvin Hill]]

CATEGORIES: 1947 births, Sportspeople from Baltimore, Maryland, American football running backs, Living people

Calvin Hill (born January 2, 1947) is an American retired football player. For twelve seasons, he played running back in the National Football League. He played for Washington Redskins, the Dallas Cowboys, and the Cleveland Browns.

Hill was named Pro-Back four times.

Hill was honored by Yale University for a Doctor of Humane Letters degree.

Hill was born in Baltimore, Maryland.

[[Joan Micklin Silver]]

CATEGORIES: 1935 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from vascular dementia, American movie directors, American screenwriters, Writers from Omaha, Nebraska

Joan Micklin Silver (May 24, 1935 – December 31, 2020) was American director and writer. She was born in Omaha, Nebraska. Silver was known for directing Hester Street (1975) and Crossing Delancey (1988). 

Silver died on December 31, 2020 in New York City from problems caused by vascular dementia at the age of 85.

[[Dušan Jovanović (theatre director)]]

CATEGORIES: 1939 births, 2020 deaths, Slovenian people, Theatre directors, Playwrights, Essayists

Dušan Jovanović (1 October 1939 — 31 December 2020) was a Slovene theatre director, playwright and essayist. He was  known for his experimental satirical theatre. In 2005, he became president of the Prešeren Foundation.

Jovanović died on 31 December 2020 at aged 81.

[[Joe Neal]]

CATEGORIES: 1935 births, 2020 deaths, State legislators of the United States, Politicians from Louisiana, Politicians from Nevada, US Democratic Party politicians

Joseph M. Neal Jr. (July 28, 1935 – December 31, 2020) was an American politician. He was a Democratic member of the Nevada Senate from 1973 to 2004. He was the first African-American state senator in Nevada. He was Minority Floor leader in 1989 and as President pro tempore in 1991. Neal was born in Mound, Louisiana.

Neal died on December 31, 2020 at the age of 85.

[[Mound, Louisiana]]

CATEGORIES: Villages in Louisiana

Mound is a village in Madison Parish, Louisiana, United States. Twelve people lived here at the 2000 census.  Its ZIP Code is 71282.

[[Stephanie Beacham]]

CATEGORIES: 1947 births, English television actors, English stage actors, English radio actors, English movie actors, Actors from London, Living people

Stephanie Beacham (born 28 February 1947) is an English theatre, television, radio and movie actress. She is known for her television roles in the BBC drama Tenko. She played Sable Colby in the ABC soap operas The Colbys (1985) and Dynasty (1985 and in 1988-89).

Beacham's movie appearances include Troop Beverly Hills (1989). 

Beacham began appearing on British television in 1967. She began movies three years later.

Beacham was nominated for a Golden Globe Award for her role in Sister Kate on NBC (1989-90).

Beacham later played Maria Callas onstage in a 2010 UK touring production of the play Master Class.

Beckham was born in London.

[[Ben Chafin]]

CATEGORIES: 1960 births, 2021 deaths, State legislators of the United States, Politicians from Virginia, US Republican Party politicians, Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States

Augustus Benton "Ben" Chafin Jr. (May 18, 1960 – January 1, 2021) was an American lawyer, farmer, and politician. He was a member of the Republican Party. He was born in Abingdon, Virginia. In 2014, he was a member of the Virginia House of Delegates. From 2014 until his death, he was a member of the State Senate.

Chafin died on January 1, 2021 at a hospital in Richmond, Virginia from problems caused by COVID-19 at the age of 60.

[[Isolation for the purpose of abuse]]

CATEGORIES: Psychology

Isolation is often used to get more power over a person. This power is then used for abuse.  Isolating the victim from the outside world is important to get  psychological control over the victim. Isolation reduces the opportunity of the victim to be rescued. It will also make the victim more dependent on the abuser.

This includes controlling a persons social activity: the people they see, the people they talk to, and the places they visit. Sometimes it also includes controlling the material they read. It can also include wanting to know where the victim is. Very often, a victim has to get permission to get medical treatment.

Isolation is often combined with other forms of abuse:

Cults often use these techniques.

[[Divide and conquer]]

CATEGORIES: Politics

Divide and conquer, also called divide and rule, is a strategy to gain and maintain power. This is done by breaking up bigger groups into smaller ones, the smaller groups are easier to control. The original Latin phrase is divide et impera (which translates as 'divide and command').

[[Taye Diggs]]

CATEGORIES: 1971 births, African American actors, American musical theatre actors, American movie actors, American television actors, Actors from Newark, New Jersey, Living people

Scott Leo "Taye" Diggs (born January 2, 1971) is an American actor and singer. He acted in Broadway musicals Rent and Hedwig and the Angry Inch. He acted in the movies How Stella Got Her Groove Back and Brown Sugar.

Diggs was born in Newark, New Jersey. He was raised in Rochester, New York.

[[Smear campaign]]

CATEGORIES: Politics, Sociology

A smear campaign, or smear tactic is an effort to damage or question someone's reputation. It may apply to individuals or groups.

[[Class consciousness]]

CATEGORIES: Marxism, Society

In Marxism, class consciousness is one's awareness (consciousness) of where one belongs in a system of social classes.

According to Marx, there are two classes in capitalism. They are the bourgeoisie and the proletariat. The bourgeoisie take advantage of the proletariat and control the means of production. The proletariat class has more people than the bourgeoisie but do not own the means of production. The proletariat are usually workers.

According to Marxism, many members of the proletariat class have false consciousness. That means they usually think about themselves and are not aware of the class struggle going on in society or how the proletariat is being hurt by the bourgeoisie. An example of false consciousness would be the idea of the American Dream.

When enough members of the proletariat have class consciousness, they will be able to unite and overthrow the capitalist system.

[[Carlos Escudé]]

CATEGORIES: 1948 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Argentina, Academics, Writers from Buenos Aires

Carlos Andrés Escudé Carvajal (10 August 1948 – 1 January 2021) was an Argentine political scientist and author. He was special advisor to foreign minister Guido di Tella. He was born in Buenos Aires. He was a visiting professor at Harvard University. 

Escudé died on 1 January 2021 in Buenos Aires from COVID-19 at aged 72. 

[[Bernard Guignedoux]]

CATEGORIES: 1947 births, 2021 deaths, French footballers, French football managers

Bernard Guignedoux (31 January 1947 – 1 January 2021) was a French footballer and manager. He was the first player in Paris Saint-Germain to score a goal in the team's history.

[[Saint-Germain-en-Laye]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Yvelines, Subprefectures in France

Saint-Germain-en-Laye (sɛ̃.ʒɛʁmɛ̃.ɑ̃.lɛ) is a commune in the Yvelines department in the Île-de-France in north-central France.

[[Mohammad-Taqi Mesbah-Yazdi]]

CATEGORIES: 1935 births, 2021 deaths, Iranian politicians, Philosophers

Ayatollah Taqi Mesbah (تقی مصباح‌; born Taqi Givechi, تقی گیوه‌چی), commonly known as Mohammad-Taqi Mesbah-Yazdi (محمدتقی مصباح‌ یزدی, 31 January 1935 – 1 January 2021) was an Iranian Shi'i cleric, philosopher and conservative political theorist. He was a spiritual leader of the Front of Islamic Revolution Stability. From 1999 to 2016, he was a member of the Assembly of Experts. Mesbah Yazdi was born in Yazd, Iran. 

Mesbah Yazdi died on 1 January 2020 in Tehran at aged 85.

[[Vladimir Korenev]]

CATEGORIES: 1940 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Russia, Russian movie actors, Russian stage actors, Soviet movie actors, Russian educators

Vladimir Borisovich Korenev (Влади́мир Бори́сович Ко́ренев; June 20, 1940 – January 2, 2021) was a Soviet-Russian actor and teacher. He was awarded People's Artist of Russia in 1998. Korenev was born in Sevastopol, Soviet Union. He was known for his roles in Amphibian Man, Children of Don Quixote and Criminal Talent. His career began in 1962.

Korenev died of COVID-19 on January 2, 2020 in Moscow, aged 80.

[[June 1962 Alcatraz escape attempt]]

CATEGORIES: 1960s crimes, Crime in California, June events, 1962 in the United States, 1960s in California, San Francisco Bay Area

The June 1962 Alcatraz escape  was a prison escape from Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary in San Francisco Bay. Inmates Frank Morris and brothers John and Clarence Anglin were the ones who escaped from the prison. The three men were able to escape from their cells and leave the island in a raft.

However it is unknown if Morris and the Aglin brothers escaped alive or drowned to death. The inmates who escaped created fake heads to trick the guards into thinking they were asleep in their cells. They also made a raft to escape.

In 1979, the FBI officially closed its investigation, saying that the men drowned in San Francisco Bay, while trying to reach land. However, the United States Marshals Service has continued to keep the escapees on its wanted list as many people reported to have seen them in Florida, Maryland and even Brazil. 

[[Allison Miller]]

CATEGORIES: 1985 births, Living people, American movie actors, American television actors, American voice actors, Actors from Rome

Allison Miller (born September 2, 1985) is an American actress. She played Michelle Benjamin on the NBC series Kings, Skye Tate on the Fox series Terra Nova, and Carrie on the NBC series Go On.

[[Josie Loren]]

CATEGORIES: 1987 births, Living people, American movie actors, American television actors, American voice actors, Actors from Miami, Florida

Josie Loren Lopez (born March 19, 1987) known professionally as Josie Loren, is an American actress. She played Kaylie Cruz in the ABC Family series Make It or Break It, and as FBI Agent Michelle Vega in the TV series The Mentalist.

[[Thomas Lennon]]

CATEGORIES: 1970 births, Living people, American movie actors, American television actors, American stage actors, American voice actors, American novelists, American television producers, American television directors, Comedians from Illinois, Screenwriters from Illinois, Actors from Illinois, People from Oak Park, Illinois

Thomas Patrick Lennon (born August 9, 1970) is an American actor, comedian, screenwriter, producer, director and novelist. He played Lieutenant Jim Dangle on the Comedy Central series Reno 911! and Felix Unger on the CBS series The Odd Couple. He also wrote the screenplay for Night at the Museum, The Pacifier, Balls of Fury, and Baywatch.

[[MF Doom]]

CATEGORIES: 1971 births, 2020 deaths, British rap musicians, American rap musicians, British songwriters, American songwriters, Record producers, Businesspeople from London, Writers from London, Musicians from London, Naturalized citizens of the United States

Daniel Dumile (ˈ DOOM; 13 July 1971 – 31 October 2020) was a British-American rapper, songwriter and record producer. He was born in London. His career began in 1988. He worked with Madlib and the two made a duo known as Madvillain. Their album Madvillainy is well known.

Dumile died on 31 October 2020, aged 49. His death was announced two months later on 31 December by his wife.

[[Jacques Golliet]]

CATEGORIES: 1931 births, 2020 deaths, French mayors

Jacques Golliet (14 December 1931 – 31 October 2020) was a French politician. He was a Senator from Haute-Savoie from 28 September 1986 to 1 October 1995. He also was Mayor of Thônes from 1974 to 1983. Golliet was a member of the Union for French Democracy and Centre of Social Democrats.

Golliet died on 31 October 2020, aged 88.

[[Thônes]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Haute-Savoie

Thônes is a commune in the Haute-Savoie department in the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region in south-eastern France

[[Laurence Pope]]

CATEGORIES: 1945 births, 2020 deaths, Ambassadors of the United States, Politicians from New Haven, Connecticut, US Democratic Party politicians, Deaths from cardiac arrest, Deaths from pancreatic cancer, Cancer deaths in the United States

Laurence Everett Pope II (September 24, 1945 – October 31, 2020) was an American politician. He was born in New Haven, Connecticut. Pope worked for US Presidents Bill Clinton and Barack Obama as a diplomat. From 1993 to 1996, Pope was the Ambassador to Chad. In 2000, President Clinton nominated him to be Ambassador to Kuwait but Pope was not confirmed by the United States Senate.

Pope was a special envoy to Libya from October 11, 2012 until January 4, 2013 during the aftermath of the 2012 Benghazi attack.

Pope died on October 31, 2020 at his home in Portland, Maine from cardiac arrest caused by pancreatic cancer, aged 75.

[[Barry Austin]]

CATEGORIES: 1968 births, 2021 deaths, People from West Midlands (county)

Barry Austin (17 September 1968 – 1 January 2021) was a British man from Chelmsley Wood, West Midlands, England. He was the fattest man in the United Kingdom. He weighed around 700 lbs or 320 kg. In December 2009 Austin played 'Big Brian' in ITV1's comedy-drama The Fattest Man in Britain as Fat Brian. 

Austin died on 1 January 2021 at the age of 52.

[[Marco Formentini (politician)]]

CATEGORIES: 1930 births, 2021 deaths, MEPs for Italy, Former MEPs, Mayors, People from Milan

Marco Formentini (14 April 1930 – 2 January 2021) was an Italian politician. He was a member of the Northern League, then for the Democrats and finally for The Daisy. He was born in La Spezia, Italy.

He was a member of the Italian parliament from 1992 to 1993. He later was a member of the European Parliament from 1994 to 2004. From 1993 to 1997, Formentini was Mayor of Milan.

Formentini died on 2 January 2020 in Milan, aged 90.

[[Pommard]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Côte-d'Or

Pommard is a commune in the Côte-d'Or department and Bourgogne-Franche-Comté region of eastern France.

Pommard is near Beaune and on the Route des Grands Crus.

The D973 and D17 pass through the commune.

Pommard is twinned with Nackenheim, Germany.

[[Meursault]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Côte-d'Or

Meursault is a commune in the Côte-d'Or department and Bourgogne-Franche-Comté region in eastern France.

The D23, D17E, D113B and D974 roads pass through or near Meursault.

[[Wahid Hamed]]

CATEGORIES: 1944 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from myocardial infarction, Egyptian writers, Screenwriters

Wahid Hamed (1 July 1944 – 2 January 2021) was an Egyptian screenwriter. He was born in Minya al-Qamh, Egypt. His career began in 1974. He was best known for writing the screenplay of Terrorism and Kebab (1992), Ma'ali al Wazir (2003) and The Yacoubian Building (2006).

Hamed died on 2 January 2021 from a heart attack in Cairo, Egypt at the age of 76.

[[Yuri Saukh]]

CATEGORIES: 1951 births, 2021 deaths, Soviet sportspeople, Russian footballers, Russian football managers

Yuri Vasilyevich Saukh (Юрий Васильевич Саух) (September 14, 1951 – January 2, 2021) was a Soviet football player and Russian coach and manager. He played for the Soviet Union national football team in 1976. 

His playing career lasted from 1970 to 1981. He played for Rotor Volgograd, Rostov-on-Don, CSKA Moscow, Lokomotiv Moscow and Dynamo Stavropol.

His managing career lasted from 2003 to 2007 where he managed for Reutov and Luch-Energiya Vladivostok.

Saukh died on January 2, 2021 at the age of 69.

[[FC Rotor Volgograd]]

CATEGORIES: 20th century establishments in Russia, 1929 establishments in Europe, Russian football clubs, Volgograd

SC Rotor Volgograd (СK Ротор) is a Russian professional football  club from the large city of Volgograd, Volgograd Oblast (formerly Stalingrad).

They played at the top level of Soviet/Russian football either side of World War II from 1989 to 1990, and from 1991 to 2004. 

The team currently plays its home games at the Volgograd Arena since 2018.

[[José Cleonâncio da Fonseca]]

CATEGORIES: 1936 births, 2021 deaths, Brazilian politicians, Brazilian businesspeople

José Cleonâncio da Fonseca (14 December 1936 – 1 January 2021) was a Brazilian businessman and politician. He was born in Boquim, Brazil.

Fonseca was a member of the Sergipe Legislative Assembly from 1967 to 1972 and again from 1975 to 1987. He was Mayor of Boquim from 1973 to 1974. Fonseca was a member of the Chamber of Deputies from 1987 to 2007.

Fonseca died on 1 January 2021 in Aracaju, Brazil at the age of 84.

[[Michael McKevitt]]

CATEGORIES: 1949 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from cancer, Irish Republican Army, People from County Louth, Political activists, Provisional Irish Republican Army, Terrorists

Michael McKevitt (4 September 1949 – 2 January 2021) was an Irish republican paramilitary leader. He was the Provisional Irish Republican Army's Quartermaster General. In 1997, he created the Real Irish Republican Army, a splinter group, in protest at the PIRA's ceasefire that year. He was in charge of the RIRA during the Omagh bombing of 1998. In 2003 in Dublin, he was convicted of directing terrorism as its leader. He was also convicted of membership of an illegal organisation. He was sentenced to 20 years imprisonment. He was released in 2016. 

McKevitt was born in County Louth, Republic of Ireland. He was married to Bernadette Sands McKevitt, a sister of furniture shop bomber, hunger striker and member of parliament Bobby Sands. McKevitt died on 2 January 2021 from cancer, aged 71.

[[Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media]]

CATEGORIES: Government ministers, Government of the Republic of Ireland

The Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media (An tAire Turasóireachta, Cultúir, Ealaíon, Gaeltachta, Spóirt agus Meán) is the senior minister at the Department of Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media in the Government of Ireland.

The current minister is Catherine Martin, TD.

[[Department of Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and Youth]]

CATEGORIES: Ireland

The Department of Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and Youth (An Roinn Leanaí, Comhionannais, Míchumais, Lánpháirtíochta agus Óige) is a department of the Government of Ireland. It is led by the Minister for Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and Youth.

The official headquarters and ministerial offices of the department are on Baggot Street, Dublin 2. 

[[Labour Party (Ireland)]]

CATEGORIES: 20th century establishments in the Republic of Ireland, 1912 establishments in Europe, Political parties in Europe, Politics of Ireland

The Labour Party (Páirtí an Lucht Oibre, literally "Party of the Working People") is a social democratic political party in the Republic of Ireland. It was founded on 28 May 1912 in Clonmel, County Tipperary, by James Connolly, James Larkin and William O'Brien.

The party was a part of the Irish Trades Union Congress. It was known as the "democratic socialist party" in its creation. 

[[Galway West (Dáil constituency)]]

CATEGORIES: 20th century establishments in the Republic of Ireland, 1937 establishments in Europe, Politics of Ireland

Galway West is a parliamentary constituency represented in Dáil Éireann, the lower house of the Irish parliament or Oireachtas. The constituency elects 5 deputies (Teachtaí Dála, commonly known as TDs). It was created in 1937.

[[Modibo Keita (born 1942)]]

CATEGORIES: 1942 births, 2021 deaths, Prime Ministers of Mali

Modibo Keita (31 July 1942 – 2 January 2021) was a Malian politician. He was the Prime Minister of Mali two times: from 18 March 2002 to 8 June 2002 and from January 2015 to April 2017. Keita was born in Koulikoro, French Sudan. He was a member of the Alliance for Democracy.

Keita died on 2 January 2021 at the age of 78.

[[Liam Reilly]]

CATEGORIES: 1955 births, 2021 deaths, Irish singer-songwriters, Irish musicians, Keyboardists, Irish rock musicians, Irish pop singers, Eurovision Song Contest entrants

Liam Reilly (29 January 1955 – 1 January 2021) was an Irish pop rock singer-songwriter and keyboardist. He was a member of the group Bagatelle. He was born in Dundalk, Ireland. He participated in the 1990 Eurovision Song Contest with his single "Somewhere in Europe". He also wrote the 1991 Eurovision Irish submission "Could It Be That I'm in Love". 

Reilly died suddenly at his home in Dundalk on 1 January 2021 at the age of 65.

[[Dustin Higgs]]

CATEGORIES: 1972 births, 2021 deaths, African-American people, American people executed for murder, Criminals from New York, People executed by lethal injection, People from Poughkeepsie, New York

Dustin John Higgs (March 10, 1972 – January 16, 2021) was an American murderer. He was born in Poughkeepsie, New York. Higgs was sentenced to death for the murders of three young women in Maryland.

The main controversy about Higgs's case was that Higgs did not personally kill any of the three victims. The man who fatally shot all three women to death, Willis Mark Haynes, was sentenced to life plus 45 years, while Higgs, who was in a vehicle when the killings took place, received a death sentence. 

It was argued that although Higgs did not kill anyone, he was the person in charge, and not only ordered Haynes to kill the women but bullied him into it.

Higgs was scheduled for execution by lethal injection on January 15, 2021. He was executed on January 16 at the USP Terre Haute in Terre Haute, Indiana at the age of 48.

[[Granite, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: Unincorporated communities in Maryland

Granite is an unincorporated community in Baltimore County, Maryland, United States.

[[La Rochepot]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Côte-d'Or

La Rochepot is a commune in the Côte-d'Or department and Bourgogne-Franche-Comté region of eastern France.

The D973, D906, D33 and D111D roads pass through La Rochepot.

[[Boquim]]

CATEGORIES: Cities in Sergipe

Boquim is a city in the Brazilian state of Sergipe. 24,923 people lived here in 2005. The area of the city is 215 km².

[[2020 United States Senate election in Alabama]]

CATEGORIES: 21st century in Alabama, 2020 United States Senate elections

An election happened on November 3, 2020 to elect a Senator from Alabama. The two people in the election were Doug Jones (Democratic Party) and Tommy Tuberville (Republican Party). Tuberville won the election with 60.2% of the vote. He became a Senator on January 3, 2021 when he was sworn in.

The Universidad Nacional de Colombia or National University of Columbia was established in 1867.  It is in Bogota, Colombia.

[[Busby Babes]]

CATEGORIES: Names, Association football

The Busby Babes was a nickname given to a group of association football players that played for Manchester United. The players with this nickname were recruited by Manchester United's chief scout Joe Armstrong and assistant manager Jimmy Murphy, and would be progressed to the first team by manager Matt Busby. The term was commonly used for players who joined the Manchester United academy during the 1940s and 1950s.

[[Emma's Theatre]]

CATEGORIES: 2000s Canadian television series, 2000s British television series, 2007 British television series debuts, 2009 British television series endings

Emma's Theatre is a Canadian-British-Israeli computer-animated children's television series. It formerly aired on Kids' CBC in Canada, and Playhouse Disney in the United States between programs from July 10, 2007 to June 9, 2009.

It was currently aired on BabyTV in the United Kingdom, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, France, Spain, Portugal, Germany, Italy, Latin America, Netherlands, Poland, Russia, Turkey, India, United Arab Emirates, and Israel.

The program aims to introduce babies and toddlers to different cultures and to expose them to different places and countries through short stories. The show is produced by PitchiPoy Animation Productions and distributed by Decode Entertainment, a DHX Media company.

[[Cree Cicchino]]

CATEGORIES: 2002 births, American actors, Living people

Cree Cicchino (born May 2002) is an American actor. She began her career as a child actor playing one of the lead roles, Babe, on the Nickelodeon comedy television show Game Shakers. She then went on to play Marisol Fuentes on the Netflix comedy television show  Mr. Iglesias, and to play Mim in the 2020 Netflix movie The Sleepover.

[[Madisyn Shipman]]

CATEGORIES: 2002 births, American actors

American actress

Madisyn Shipman (born November 20, 2002) is an American actress. She played Kenzie Bell in the Nickelodeon sitcom Game Shakers.

[[Kel Mitchell]]

CATEGORIES: 1978 births, American actors

Kel Johari Rice Mitchell (born August 25, 1978) is an American actor, stand-up comedian, musician, singer, and rapper. He was a regular cast member of the Nickelodeon  show All That. He played the Invisible Boy in the 1999 Ben Stiller and Geoffrey Rush superhero movie Mystery Men, Kel Kimble on the Nickelodeon sitcom Kenan & Kel, and Ed in the movie Good Burger. Mitchell was the voice of Dutch in the Disney XD cartoon Motorcity. He was Ray in the 2006 sequel to Like Mike, Like Mike 2: Streetball. He also starred as Double G on the Nickelodeon series Game Shakers. Mitchell was on Dancing with the Stars on the 28th season and placed 2nd alongside his partner Witney Carson.

Anderson IMDb resume photoElla Aiko Anderson (born March 26, 2005) is an American actor. She began her career as a child actor, starring as Piper on the Nickelodeon show Henry Danger, and played Rachel Rawlings in the 2016 comedy adventure movie The Boss.

[[Cass Timberlane]]

CATEGORIES: 1947 movies, 1940s romance movies, 1940s drama movies, American romantic drama movies, Movies based on books, MGM movies, Movies directed by George Sidney

Cass Timberlane is a 1947 American romantic drama movie directed by George Sidney and was based on the 1945 novel of the same name by Sinclair Lewis. It stars Spencer Tracy, Lana Turner, Zachary Scott, Tom Drake, Mary Astor, Albert Dekker, Margaret Lindsay, Josephine Hutchinson, Frank Wilcox and was distributed by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

[[Raccoon Strait]]

CATEGORIES: Straits, Bodies of water of California, San Francisco Bay Area, Marin County, California

The Raccoon Strait is a strait in north San Francisco Bay. It is between the Tiburon Peninsula (mainland Marin County), and Angel Island. The strait is around 27 meters deep, and is around 1 km wide.

[[Azusa Street Revival]]

The Azusa Street Revival was a revival meeting that took place on April the 14th in 1906. William J. Seymour had led it - he was an African-American preacher. This meeting was historic because it played an important role in the spread of Pentecostalism in the 20th century.

[[GNU Compiler Collection]]

CATEGORIES: Free software, Linux software

The GNU Compiler Collection (also known as GCC) is a free software compiler written as part of the GNU project. It originally only compiled C code into machine language, however, now many frontends have been created to allow it to compile other languages.

As well as being the compiler for GNU, it is used by many other projects, most notably many Linux-based operating systems.

[[Mundamia]]

CATEGORIES: Settlements in New South Wales

Mundamia is a suburb in the City of Shaolhaven in South Coast in New South Wales in Australia.

It is about 5 km west of Nowra by road.

In 2016, 70 people lived there.

University of Wollongong's Shaolhaven campus is built there.

[[African Continental Free Trade Area]]

CATEGORIES: Politics of Africa, January 2021 events

The African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA) is a free trade area founded in 2018. The trade system officially began on 1 January 2021. It was created by the African Continental Free Trade Agreement among 54 of the 55 African Union nations.

[[Cuban convertible peso]]

CATEGORIES: Currency of North America, Cuba

The convertible peso (sometimes given as CUC$ and informally called a cuc or a chavito) was one of two official currencies in Cuba, the other being the Cuban peso. It has been in limited use since 1994.

On 8 November 2004, the U.S. dollar was officially no longer accepted in Cuba (though unofficially it was). Its value was increased to US$1.08 in April 2005, but went back to US$1.00 on 15 March 2011.

On 22 October 2013, it was announced that the convertible peso would end, being gradually unified with the lower-value Cuban peso. On 10 December 2020, it was announced that the convertible peso will no longer be in effect, from 1 January 2021.

[[Cuban peso]]

CATEGORIES: Currency of North America, Cuba

The Cuban peso is the only national currency in Cuba. On 1 January 2021, it became the only national currency when Cuban convertible peso was no longer in effect. 

The peso range from $1, $3, $5, $10, $20, $50, $100, $200 and $500.

[[Pennsylvania General Assembly]]

CATEGORIES: State legislatures of the United States, Pennsylvania

The Pennsylvania General Assembly is the legislature of Pennsylvannia. It has two parts: the Pennsylvania House of Representatives (lower house) and the Pennsylvania State Senate (upper house). Before this legislature started, there was the Pennsylvania Provincial Assembly. This was unicameral, which means it had only one house. It has been called the general assembly since 1776, and has been bicameral (has two houses) since 1791.

Both houses meet in the Pennsylvania State Capitol in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania. They are both controlled by the Republican Party as of 2020.

[[São José do Rio Preto]]

CATEGORIES: Cities in São Paulo (state)

São José do Rio Preto (sɐ̃w̃ ʒuˈzɛ du ʁiw ˈpɾetu) is a city in the state of São Paulo, Brazil. The city is in the north/northwest part of the state, 440 km (273 mi) from the city of São Paulo and 700 km (435 mi) from Brasília. 456,245 people lived here, making it the 36th biggest in Brazil.

[[Papurana milleti]]

CATEGORIES: Animals of Oceania, Frogs

The Dalat frog, Banna frog, Millet's forestfrog or Millet's frog (Papurana milleti) is a frog from Vietnam, Thailand and Cambodia.  Scientists think it might also live in Laos.

[[2018 Alabama gubernatorial election]]

CATEGORIES: Elections in the United States, November 2018 events, Alabama

On November 6, 2018 the 2018 Alabama gubernatorial election was held to elect the Governor of Alabama. Incumbent Republican Kay Ivey squared off against Democratic challenger Walter Maddox. Kay Ivey replaced Governor Robert Bentley after he resigned on April 10, 2017. She was running for a full term during this election. Kay achieved that goal and defeated Walter Maddox, who was the mayor of Tuscaloosa. She was sworn in on January 14, 2019.

[[Knight Capital Group]]

The Knight Capital Group is an American global financial services firm engaging in market making, electronic execution, and institutional sales and trading. With its high-frequency trading algorithms Knight was the largest trader in U.S. equities, with a market share of 17.3% on NYSE and 16.9% on NASDAQ.

[[Nadia Sayers]]

CATEGORIES: Beauty pageant winners, 1994 births, Living people, People from the Republic of Ireland, Irish people

Nadia Sayers (born 1994) is an Irish model, actress, and beauty pageant titleholder who was appointed as Miss Universe Ireland 2020 and represented Ireland at Miss Universe 2020.

[[Clint Boulton]]

CATEGORIES: 1948 births, 2021 deaths, English footballers, People from Stoke-on-Trent, Sportspeople from Staffordshire

Clinton William Boulton (6 January 1948 – 1 January 2021) was an English professional footballer. He was a defender. He made 506 league appearances in a 14-year career in the Football League.

He began his professional career with Port Vale in August 1965. He later played for Torquay United. He left the club in 1979 and later played for non-league side Minehead.

[[Floyd Little]]

CATEGORIES: 1942 births, 2021 deaths, Cancer deaths in the United States, Denver Broncos players, Sportspeople from New Haven, Connecticut

Floyd Douglas Little (July 4, 1942 – January 1, 2021) was an American professional football player. He was a halfback for the Denver Broncos from 1967 to 1975. He was born in New Haven, Connecticut.

Little was elected to the College Football Hall of Fame in 1983 and the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2010.

Little died on January 1, 2021 from cancer in Las Vegas, Nevada at the age of 78.

[[Arsenio Lope Huerta]]

CATEGORIES: 1943 births, 2021 deaths, Spanish politicians, Spanish writers, Spanish economists, Spanish lawyers

Arsenio Lope Huerta (15 November 1943 – 2 January 2021) was a Spanish lawyer, politician, writer and economist. He was born in Alcalá de Henares, Spain. Lope Huerta was a member of the Spanish Socialist Workers' Party. From 1983 to 1987, he was Mayor of Alcalá de Henares.

Lope Huerta died on 2 January 2021 in Alcalá de Henares at the age of 77.

[[Mike Reese (Pennsylvania politician)]]

CATEGORIES: 1978 births, 2021 deaths, State legislators of the United States, Politicians from Pennsylvania, US Republican Party politicians

Michael P. Reese (March 7, 1978 – January 2, 2021) was an American politician. He was a Republican member of the Pennsylvania House of Representatives from 2009 until his death in 2021. He was born in Mount Pleasant Township, Pennsylvania.

Reese died on January 2, 2021 in Greensburg, Pennsylvania from a brain aneurysm at the age of 42.

[[Mount Pleasant Township, Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania]]

CATEGORIES: Townships in Pennsylvania

Mount Pleasant Township is a township in Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania, United States. In the 2000 census, 11,153 people lived here.

[[Mount Pleasant, Pennsylvania]]

CATEGORIES: Boroughs in Pennsylvania

Mount Pleasant is a borough in Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania, United States. It is 45 miles (72 km) southeast of Pittsburgh. In the 2010 census, 4,454 people lived here.

[[Trent University]]

CATEGORIES: 1964 establishments in Canada, Colleges and universities in Canada, Ontario

Trent University is a public liberal arts university in Peterborough, Ontario. It also has a campus in Oshawa. Trent uses an Oxbridge college system and small class sizes.

[[Rudolf Vatinyan]]

CATEGORIES: Armenian people, Cinematographers, 1941 births, 2021 deaths

Rudolf Vatinyan (Ռուդոլֆ Վաթինյան; 12 May 1941 – 2 January 2021) was an Armenian cinematographer. He was born in Dilijan, Armenia. His career began in 1970 and he retired in 2009. He worked on the 1985 historical drama The Tango of Our Childhood.

Vatinyan died on 2 January 2021 in Yerevan, Armenia at the age of 79.

[[Fatty liver disease]]

CATEGORIES: Diseases

Fatty liver disease (FLD), also known as hepatic steatosis, is a condition where a lot of fat builds up in the liver. Sometimes, there are no or few symptoms. There can be pain in the upper right side of the abdomen. The disease can cause cirrhosis, liver cancer, and esophageal cuts.

[[Anna Richardson]]

CATEGORIES: 1970 births, Living people, Bisexual people, Channel 4 presenters, English journalists, English LGBT people, English television presenters, English television producers, People from Shropshire

Anna Clare Richardson (born 27 September 1970) is an English television presenter, writer and journalist. She has presented many television shows for Channel 4, including Supersize vs Superskinny (2008–2009), The Sex Education Show (2008–2011), Secret Eaters (2012–2014), Supershoppers (2016–2019) and Naked Attraction (2016–present).

Richardson was born in Wellington, Shropshire. She dated television director Charles Martin for 18 years. Since 2014, she has dated comedian Sue Perkins.

Richardson sued Arnold Schwarzenegger and two of his aides after comments they made about her claims that Schwarzenegger had groped her. The case was settled in 2006.

[[Andrew Ridgeley]]

CATEGORIES: 1963 births, Living people, English rock singers, English rock guitarists, English singer-songwriters, English pop singers, English pop musicians, Musicians from Surrey, Singers from Surrey, Writers from Surrey

Andrew John Ridgeley (born 26 January 1963) is an English singer-songwriter and record producer. He was half of the musical duo Wham! in the 1980s.

[[Paul Westphal]]

CATEGORIES: 1950 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from glioblastoma, Boston Celtics players, Phoenix Suns players, Seattle SuperSonics players, New York Knicks players, Sportspeople from California, Sportspeople from Arizona, People from Scottsdale, Arizona, American sports commentators, National Basketball Association coaches, Cancer deaths in Arizona

Paul Douglas Westphal (November 30, 1950 – January 2, 2021) was an American basketball player, head coach, and commentator. He was born in Torrance, California. His played from 1972 to 1984. He coached from 1985 to 2016.

Westphal played for the National Basketball Association for the Boston Celtics, Phoenix Suns, Seattle SuperSonics and New York Knicks. He coached the Sacramento Kings and was an assistant coach for the New York Knicks and the Dallas Mavericks.

In 2019, Westphal became a member of the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame.

In August 2020, Westphal was diagnosed with glioblastoma. He died from the disease on January 2, 2021 in Scottsdale, Arizona at the age of 70.

[[Emily Tyra]]

CATEGORIES: 1987 births, Living people, People with cancer, American movie actors, American television actors, American stage actors, American dancers, Singers from Minneapolis, Minnesota, Actors from Minneapolis, Minnesota

Emily Tyra (born November 9, 1987) is an American actress, singer and dancer. She was born in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Her career began in 2005. She began dancing with Boston Ballet. 

In 2011, she made her Broadway debut as a singer and dancer in Hugh Jackman: Back on Broadway. She played Dr. Noa Kean in CBS' Code Black and Sasha in the horror-comedy movie Harpoon.

In March 2019, Tyra was diagnosed with brain cancer.

[[Tiger Shroff]]

CATEGORIES: Living people, 1990 births, Indian movie actors, Taekwondo practitioners, Actors from Mumbai

Tiger Shroff, born Jai Hemant Shroff, is an Indian actor who stars in Hindi langauge films in the Bollywood movie industry. He is the eldest child of Bollywood star Jackie Shroff and his wife Ayesha Shroff. His debut film is called Heropanti, which was released in 2014 with him taking up the lead role alongside lead actress Kriti Sanon. Forbes 100 has named Tiger Shroff as one of the most influential and wealthiest Bollywood actors.

Tiger Shroff is of Bengali and Gujarati descent from both of his parents. He has a younger sister, Ayesha, who is three years junior to him. He is also known for the foundation of the company Prowl and is a prominent symbol of Pepsi India. He has also helped many actors train for their movies.

Tiger Shroff has starred in many bollywood films including the Baaghi series. His next films, Rambo, Ganapath and Heropanti 2 are expected to be filmed in the year 2021 where the films will be released the following year. Tiger Shroff is a devotee of Lord Shiva, the supreme god of Hinduism, and holds a fast every Monday. He is also a professional dancer and model alongside his acting career.

[[Autun]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Saône-et-Loire, Subprefectures in France

Autun is a commune and subprefecture in the Saône-et-Loire department in the Bourgogne-Franche-Comté region of central-eastern France.

[[Raúl Baglini]]

CATEGORIES: 1949 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from respiratory failure, Argentine politicians, Argentine lawyers

Raúl Baglini (December 23, 1949 – January 3, 2021) was an Argentine politician and lawyer. He was a member of the Chamber of Deputies from 1983 to 1993. Baglini was a Senator from 2002 to 2003. He was a member of the Radical Civic Union. He was born in Mendoza, Argentine.

Baglini died on January 3, 2021 at a hospital in Mendoza from respiratory failure, aged 71.

[[Don Salls]]

CATEGORIES: 1919 births, 2021 deaths, American football players, American football coaches, Sportspeople from Alabama, Sportspeople from New Jersey, People from Trenton, New Jersey, American centenarians, Purple Heart recipients

Donald J. Salls (June 24, 1919 – January 3, 2021) was an American football player and coach. He was the head football coach at Jacksonville State University from 1946 to 1952 and from 1954 to 1964. He was a Purple Heart recipient. Salls was born in Trenton, New Jersey. 

Salls died on January 3, 2021 at the age of 101.

[[David Toland]]

CATEGORIES: Living people, 1970s births, Lieutenant Governors of Kansas, US Democratic Party politicians

David C. Toland is an American politician. He is the 52nd Lieutenant Governor of Kansas since 2021, and the Kansas Secretary of Commerce since 2019. 

[[Young Kim]]

CATEGORIES: 1962 births, Living people, United States representatives from California, South Korean politicians, US Republican Party politicians, Naturalized citizens of the United States

Young Oak Kim (Choe; born October 18, 1962) is a South Korean-born American Republican politician. She is a member of the United States House of Representatives from California's 39th congressional district since 2021.

[[Ham, Somme]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Somme

Ham is a commune in the Somme department and Hauts-de-France region in northern France.

[[Michelle Steel]]

CATEGORIES: 1955 births, Living people, Naturalized citizens of the United States, South Korean politicians, United States representatives from California, US Republican Party politicians, People from Seoul

Michelle Eunjoo Park Steel (born June 21, 1955) is a South Korean-born American politician. She is the U.S. Representative for California's 48th congressional district since 2021. She beat incumbent Democrat Harley Rouda in the 2020 election. 

[[Sara Jacobs]]

CATEGORIES: 1989 births, Living people, United States representatives from California, US Democratic Party politicians

Sara Jacobs (born February 1, 1989) is an American politician. She is a member of the Democratic Party. Jacobs is the United States representative for CA since 2021. She is the youngest member of the California congressional delegation.

[[Lauren Boebert]]

CATEGORIES: 1986 births, Living people, United States representatives from Colorado, American political activists, Businesspeople from Colorado, Businesspeople from Florida, Politicians from Florida, US Republican Party politicians

Lauren Opal Boebert (born December 15, 1986) is an American politician, businesswoman, and gun-rights activist. She is a member of the United States House of Representatives for CO since 2021.

Boebert had showed support of QAnon, a far-right conspiracy theory, though she later said that she was "not a follower" of QAnon.

[[Kat Cammack]]

CATEGORIES: 1988 births, Living people, United States representatives from Florida, Politicians from Denver, Colorado, US Republican Party politicians

Kathryn "Kat" Cammack (born February 16, 1988) is an American politician and political advisor. She is a member of the United States House of Representatives from Florida's 3rd congressional district since 2021. Cammack was deputy chief of staff to Congressman Ted Yoho, who she replaced. 

Cammack is the youngest Republican woman elected to Congress in 2020; Sara Jacobs, a Democrat, is the only younger woman.

[[Nikema Williams]]

CATEGORIES: 1978 births, Living people, United States representatives from Georgia, People from Columbus, Georgia, US Democratic Party politicians

Nikema Natassha Williams (born July 30, 1978) is an American politician and political executive. Williams is a member of the United States House of Representatives since 2021. She was a member of the Georgia State Senate for the 39th district. She is also the chair of the Democratic Party of Georgia.

[[Carolyn Bourdeaux]]

CATEGORIES: 1970 births, Living people, United States representatives from Georgia, US Democratic Party politicians, Politicians from Virginia, American academics

Carolyn Bourdeaux (born June 3, 1970) is an American professor and politician. She is the U.S. Representative for Georgia's 7th congressional district since 2021. She is a member of the Democratic Party.

She was a professor at the Andrew Young School of Public Policy at Georgia State University since 2003.

[[Sun Qiaolu]]

CATEGORIES: Chinese television actors, 1995 births, 2021 deaths, Chinese businesspeople, Deaths from myocardial infarction

Sun Qiaolu (12 June, 1995 – 1 January, 2021) was a Chinese actress. Sun appeared in the Chinese children’s TV series Ba La La Little Demon Fairy as the fairy Ling Meiqi. After the show ended, she was in the fashion business and became a social media influencer.

Sun died of a heart attack on 1 January, 2021, aged 25.

[[Byron Donalds]]

Byron Lowell Donalds (born October 28, 1978) is an American politician and businessman. He is the U.S. representative for Florida's 19th congressional district since 2021.

Donalds was a member of the Florida House of Representatives from 2016 to 2021.

[[Marjorie Taylor Greene]]

CATEGORIES: 1974 births, Living people, United States representatives from Georgia, US Republican Party politicians, Businesspeople from Georgia (U.S. state)

Marjorie Taylor Greene (born May 27, 1974) is an American politician, conspiracy theorist and businesswoman. She is the U.S. Representative for GA since 2021.

She controversially became known for supporting the far-right QAnon conspiracy theory in Facebook videos.

On February 4, 2021 the House of Representatives voted to remove Marjorie Taylor Green of her committee jobs because of the extreme conspiracy theories she liked.

[[Kai Kahele]]

Kaialiʻi Kahele (born March 28, 1974) is an American politician, educator, and commercial pilot. He is a member of the United States House of Representatives from Hawaii since 2021.

He was a member of the Hawaii Senate from the 1st district. Kahele is a member of the Democratic Party. 

[[Mary Miller (politician)]]

CATEGORIES: 1959 births, Living people, United States representatives from Illinois, US Republican Party politicians, People from Naperville, Illinois

Mary Miller (born August 27, 1959) is an American politician and farmer. She is a Republican. Miller is represents IL in the United States House of Representatives since 2021.

[[Mariannette Miller-Meeks]]

CATEGORIES: 1955 births, Living people, American physicians, United States representatives from Iowa, Politicians from California, US Republican Party politicians

Mariannette Jane Miller-Meeks (born September 6, 1955) is an American physician and politician. She is a member of the United States House of Representatives since 2021.

She was a Iowa State Senator for the 41st district from January 2019 to January 2021. She was the 2020 Republican nominee for Iowa's 2nd congressional district following the retirement of incumbent Democrat Dave Loebsack. She beat Democratic nominee Rita Hart by six votes in the 2020 election. 

[[Chloe Dykstra]]

CATEGORIES: 1988 births, Models from Los Angeles, California, American television actors, Actors from Los Angeles, California, Living people

Chloe Frances Dykstra (born September 15, 1988) is an American model and actress. She produced and co-hosted the internet web series Just Cos for Nerdist Industries' YouTube channel. She is a cast member in Syfy's show Heroes of Cosplay. She is also a freelance game journalist for several websites.

Dykstra was born in Los Angeles, California.

[[Dave Loebsack]]

CATEGORIES: 1952 births, Living people, United States representatives from Iowa, American political scientists, American educators, People from Sioux City, Iowa, US Democratic Party politicians

David Wayne Loebsack (ˈ; born December 23, 1952) is an American politician. He was the U.S. Representative for IA from 2007 to 2021. He is a member of the Democratic Party. He was aprofessor of political science at Cornell College. 

On April 12, 2019, Loebsack announced he would not seek reelection.

[[Victoria Spartz]]

CATEGORIES: 1978 births, Living people, Naturalized citizens of the United States, United States representatives from Indiana, Ukrainian politicians, US Republican Party politicians

Victoria Spartz (née Kulheyko) (Viktoriya Kul'heyko); born October 6, 1978) is a Ukrainian-American politician and businesswoman. She is a member of the United States House of Representatives from Indiana's 5th congressional district since 2021. 

Spartz is the first Ukrainian-born member of the U.S. Congress and the first member born in a then-Soviet Republic.  

She was a member of the Indiana Senate from the 20th District.

[[Lisa McClain]]

Lisa McClain (nee Iovannisci; born April 7, 1966) is an American politician. She is a Republican. McClain is a member of the United States House of Representatives for MI since 2021.

[[Stockbridge, Michigan]]

CATEGORIES: Villages in Michigan

Stockbridge is a village in Ingham County in the U.S. state of Michigan.  It is about 36 southeast from downtown Lansing. 1,218 people lived here at the 2010 census.

[[Stockbridge Township, Michigan]]

CATEGORIES: Townships in Michigan

Stockbridge Township is a civil township of Ingham County in the U.S. state of Michigan. 3,896 people lived here at the 2010 census.

[[Collin Peterson]]

CATEGORIES: 1944 births, Living people, United States representatives from Minnesota, People from Fargo, North Dakota, Politicians from North Dakota, US Democratic Party politicians

Collin Clark Peterson (born June 29, 1944) is an American politician. He was a member of the U.S. Representative for MN from 1991 to 2021. He is a member of the Minnesota Democratic–Farmer–Labor Party,.

In 2020, Peterson was defeated by Republican Michelle Fischbach, ending a 30-year career in the United States House of Representatives.

[[Yvette Herrell]]

Stella Yvette Herrell (born March 16, 1964) is an American politician, businesswoman, and real estate agent. She is the U.S. Representative for New Mexico's 2nd congressional district since 2021. She is a member of the Republican Party.

She was a member of the New Mexico House of Representatives for District 51 from January 18, 2011 until January 15, 2019.

[[Rebecca Rittenhouse]]

Rebecca Rittenhouse (born November 30, 1988) is an American actress. In the primetime soap opera Blood & Oil, she played Cody LeFever. She played Dr. Anna Ziev im the Hulu romantic comedy show The Mindy Project. 

Rittenhouse was born in Los Angeles, California. She was raised in Pasadena

[[Ruidoso, New Mexico]]

[[Xochitl Torres Small]]

CATEGORIES: 1984 births, Living people, American lawyers, United States representatives from New Mexico, Politicians from Portland, Oregon, US Democratic Party politicians

Xochitl Liana Torres Small (first name pronounced ˈ SOH; born November 15, 1984) is an American lawyer and politician. She was the U.S. Representative for NM from 2019 until 2021.

She lost her 2020 re-election bid by Republican Yvette Herrell in a rematch of the 2018 congressional race.

[[Teresa Leger Fernandez]]

CATEGORIES: 1959 births, Living people, United States representatives from New Mexico, US Democratic Party politicians, Politicians from Las Vegas, Nevada

Teresa Leger Fernandez (born July 1, 1959) is an American attorney and politician. She is the Representative for New Mexico's 3rd congressional district in the United States House of Representatives since 2021.

[[Nicole Malliotakis]]

CATEGORIES: 1980 births, Living people, United States representatives from New York, Politicians from New York City, US Democratic Party politicians

Nicole Malliotakis (born November 11, 1980) is an American politician. She is the United States representative for New York's 11th congressional district since 2021. She is a member of the Republican Party. She is the first Hispanic American to win elected office in Staten Island. Malliotakis is one of the first two Greek-American women elected to office in New York State.

She was the Republican nominee in New York City's 2017 mayoral election against incumbent Mayor Bill de Blasio.

Malliotakis beat incumbent Democratic Representative Max Rose in the November 3, 2020 general election.

[[Ancelle]]

Ancelle is a commune in the Hautes-Alpes department and Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region in southeastern France.

[[Max Rose]]

CATEGORIES: 1986 births, Living people, United States representatives from New York, Jewish American politicians, Politicians from New York City, US Democratic Party politicians

Max N. Rose (born November 28, 1986) is an American politician. He was the U.S. Representative for New York's 11th congressional district from 2019 to 2021. 

From 2012 to 2013, Rose was in the U.S. Army as a platoon leader in combat in the War in Afghanistan. 

In the 2020 election, Rose lost his re-election bid to the Republican nominee, New York Assemblymember Nicole Malliotakis.

In December 2020, Rose announced his plans to run for Mayor of New York City in the 2021 election. However, soon decided not to run for the office.

On January 20, 2021, Rose was sworn in as Special Assistant to the Secretary of Defense (Senior Advisor, COVID-19) to serve under Secretary Lloyd Austin in the Joe Biden administration.

[[Deborah K. Ross]]

CATEGORIES: 1963 births, Living people, United States representatives from North Carolina, Politicians from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, US Democratic Party politicians

Deborah Ross née Koff (born June 20, 1963) is an American lawyer and politician. She is the U.S. Representative for NC. Ross was a Democratic member of the North Carolina General Assembly.

Ross was the Democratic nominee in the 2016 U.S. Senate election in North Carolina, unsuccessfully challenging incumbent Richard Burr in the general election.

[[Kathy Manning]]

CATEGORIES: 1956 births, Living people, American lawyers, United States representatives from North Carolina, Politicians from Detroit, Michigan, US Democratic Party politicians

Kathy Ellen Manning (born December 3, 1956) is an American attorney and politician. She is the United States representative for North Carolina's 6th congressional district since 2021. She was the nominee for North Carolina's 13th congressional district in the 2018 election.

[[Nancy Mace]]

CATEGORIES: 1977 births, Living people, United States representatives from South Carolina, Politicians from North Carolina, Businesspeople from South Carolina, Businesspeople from North Carolina, Writers from North Carolina, Writers from South Carolina, US Republican Party politicians, South Carolina Republicans

Nancy Ruth Mace (born December 4, 1977) is an American businesswoman, politician, and author. She is the U.S. Representative for South Carolina's 1st congressional district since 2021.

Mace also was the first woman to graduate from the Corps of Cadets program at The Citadel, in 1999.

From 2018 to 2020, Mace served as a member of the South Carolina House of Representatives for District 99.

[[Diana Harshbarger]]

Diana Harshbarger (born January 1, 1960) is an American politician and pharmacist. She is a Republican. She is a member of the United States House of Representatives representing TN since 2021.

[[Beth Van Duyne]]

Elizabeth Ann Van Duyne (born November 16, 1970) is an American politician and businesswoman. She is the United States representative for Texas's 24th congressional district since 2021. She is a member of the Republican Party. Van Duyne was a Mayor of Irving from 2011 through 2017.

[[Burgess Owens]]

CATEGORIES: 1951 births, Living people, New York Jets players, Oakland Raiders players, United States representatives from Utah, Politicians from Ohio, Businesspeople from Ohio, Sportspeople from Ohio, Businesspeople from Utah, Sportspeople from Utah, American football safeties, US Republican Party politicians, People from Columbus, Ohio

Clarence Burgess Owens (born August 2, 1951) is an American politician, non-profit executive, and retired football player. He is a U.S. Representative for Utah's 4th congressional district since 2021.

Burgess played safety for ten seasons in the National Football League (NFL) for the New York Jets and the Oakland Raiders.

[[Kelly Marie Tran]]

CATEGORIES: 1989 births, American television actors, American movie actors, Actors from San Diego, California, Living people

Kelly Marie Tran (born January 17, 1989) is an American actress. She began acting in 2011. Most of her roles are in short movies and in television. She became well known for acting in two Star Wars movies in 2017 and 2019.

Tran was born in San Diego, California.

[[Marilyn Strickland]]

CATEGORIES: 1962 births, Living people, Naturalized citizens of the United States, United States representatives from Washington, American mayors, South Korean politicians, People from Tacoma, Washington, US Democratic Party politicians, People from Seoul, Businesspeople from Washington, South Korean businesspeople

Marilyn Strickland (born September 25, 1962) is a South Korean-born American politician and businesswoman. She is the U.S. Representative for Washington's 10th congressional district since 2021. She is a member of the Democratic Party.

Strickland was the 38th Mayor of Tacoma from 2010 to 2018. She is the first member of the United States Congress who is of both Korean and African American heritage.

Strickland is also one of the first three Korean-American women ever elected to Congress, the other two being Young Kim and Michelle Steel.

[[Rosa DeLauro]]

CATEGORIES: 1943 births, Living people, United States representatives from Connecticut, Politicians from New Haven, Connecticut, US Democratic Party politicians

Rosa Luisa DeLauro d (born March 2, 1943) is an American politician. She has been the U.S. Representative for Connecticut since 1991. She is a member of the Democratic Party. 

[[Gregory Meeks]]

CATEGORIES: 1953 births, Living people, United States representatives from New York, Politicians from New York City, US Democratic Party politicians

Gregory Weldon Meeks (born September 25, 1953) is an American politician serving as the U.S. Representative for NY (formerly in the 6th district) since 1998. He is a member of the Democratic Party.

In July 2020, after the primary defeat of House Foreign Affairs Committee chairperson Eliot Engel, Meeks became chair of the committee.

[[Katherine Clark]]

CATEGORIES: 1963 births, Living people, United States representatives from Massachusetts, Politicians from New Haven, Connecticut, US Democratic Party politicians

Katherine Marlea Clark (born July 17, 1963) is an American politician. She was the United States representative for Massachusetts's 5th congressional district since 2013. She is a member of the Democratic Party. She was a member of the Massachusetts House of Representatives from 2008 to 2011 and a member of the Massachusetts Senate from 2011 to 2013.

She is the Vice Chair of the House Democratic Caucus, the sixth-ranking post in the Democratic House leadership behind the Speaker.

[[Pepperdine University]]

CATEGORIES: 1930s establishments in California, 1937 establishments in the United States, Colleges and universities in California, Malibu, California

Pepperdine University (') is a private research university who works with the Churches of Christ. Their main campus is located near Malibu, California. It was founded by entrepreneur George Pepperdine in South Los Angeles in 1937.

[[Irwin M. Jacobs]]

CATEGORIES: 1933 births, Living people, Engineers from Massachusetts, Businesspeople from Massachusetts, Scientists from Massachusetts

Irwin Mark Jacobs (born October 18, 1933) is an American electrical engineer and billionaire. He is a co-founder and former chairman of Qualcomm. He is a chair of the board of trustees of the Salk Institute.

[[Paige Rense]]

CATEGORIES: 1929 births, 2021 deaths, Cardiovascular disease deaths in Florida, American novelists, American editors, Writers from Des Moines, Iowa, Businesspeople from Iowa

Paige Rense (May 4, 1929 – January 1, 2021), also known as Paige Rense Noland, was an American editor. She was the editor in chief of Architectural Digest magazine, from 1975 until 2010. She is the founder of the Arthur Rense Prize poetry award. Rense also worked for Bon Appétit and was editor in chief of GEO. She was born in Des Moines, Iowa.

Rense died on January 1, 2021 at her home in West Palm Beach, Florida from heart disease, aged 91.

[[Bethany Joy Lenz]]

CATEGORIES: 1981 births, Singers from Florida, American television actors, American movie actors, Actors from Florida, Living people

Bethany Joy Lenz (born April 2, 1981) is an American actress, singer-songwriter and filmmaker. She played Haley James Scott on The CW's television series One Tree Hill. She also played Michelle Bauer Santos in CBS' soap opera Guiding Light.

Lenz' first professional job was in a commercial for dolls from the teen drama series Swans Crossing. She also appeared in commercials for Dr. Pepper and Eggo.

Lenz was born in Hollywood, Florida.

[[Gerry Marsden]]

CATEGORIES: 1942 births, 2021 deaths, Cardiovascular disease deaths in England, English pop singers, English pop musicians, English rock guitarists, English rock singers, English singer-songwriters, English television personalities, Infectious disease deaths in England, Musicians from Liverpool, Singers from Liverpool, Writers from Liverpool

Gerard Marsden MBE (24 September 1942 – 3 January 2021) was an English pop rock singer-songwriter, guitarist and television personality. He was best known for being leader of the Merseybeat band Gerry and the Pacemakers.

Marsden died on 3 January 2021 at the age of 78 from a heart infection in Liverpool.

[[Gary Staples]]

CATEGORIES: 1940 births, 2021 deaths, Cancer deaths in the United States, State legislators of the United States, Politicians from Mississippi, US Republican Party politicians

Gary V. Staples (January 16, 1940 – January 2, 2021) was an American Republican politician. In 2004 he was elected as a member of the Mississippi House of Representatives. Before, he was a member from 1988 to 1992. He was born in Laurel, Mississippi.

Staples died on 2 January 2021 in Laurel from cancer, aged 80.

[[Oze]]

Oze is a commune in the Hautes-Alpes department and Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region in southeastern France.

[[Subiakto Tjakrawerdaya]]

CATEGORIES: 1944 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Indonesia, Indonesian politicians, Indonesian businesspeople

Subiakto Tjakrawerdaya (10 August 1944 – 2 January 2021) was an Indonesian politician and businessman. He was born in the Cilacap Regency, Dutch East Indies. He was a member of the National Awakening Party. He was Minister of Cooperatives and Small Business from 1993 to 1998 during the Suharto presidency.

Tjakrawedaya died on 2 January 2021 at a Jakarta hospital from COVID-19 at the age of 76.

[[Brian Urquhart]]

CATEGORIES: 1919 births, 2021 deaths, British politicians, People from Dorset, British centenarians

Sir Brian Edward Urquhart GBR (28 February 1919 – 2 January 2021) was a British politician. He was important in the founding of the United Nations. He was the UN Under-Secretary General from 1971 to 1985. He was born in Bridport, England.

Urquhart died on 2 January 2021 in Tyringham, Massachusetts at the age of 101.

[[Tyringham, Massachusetts]]

CATEGORIES: Towns in Massachusetts

Tyringham is a town in Berkshire County, Massachusetts. It is part of the Pittsfield, Massachusetts Metropolitan Statistical Area. 327 people lived here at the 2010 census.

[[Mayfield Heights, Ohio]]

CATEGORIES: Cities in Ohio

Mayfield Heights is a city in Cuyahoga County, Ohio, United States. It is an east-side suburb of Cleveland. 18,827 people lived here at the 2010 census.

[[Aspres-sur-Buëch]]

Aspres-sur-Buëch is a commune in the Hautes-Alpes department and Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region in southeastern France.

[[Reagan (2021 movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 2021 movies, 2020s drama movies, Ronald Reagan, American drama movies

Reagan is an upcoming biographical historical drama movie directed by Sean McNamara. It stars Dennis Quaid and David Henrie as United States President Ronald Reagan. The movie also stars Penelope Ann Miller, Kevin Dillon, Skip Schwink, Mena Suvari, Lesley-Anne Down and Jon Voight in supporting roles.
