Kevin Brady Dillon (born August 19, 1965) is an American actor. He played Johnny "Drama" Chase on the HBO comedy series Entourage and Bunny in the war movie Platoon.

[[Lesley-Anne Down]]

CATEGORIES: 1954 births, Living people, British movie actors, British television actors, British stage actors, British voice actors, Models from London, Actors from London, Singers from London

Lesley-Anne Down (born 17 March 1954) is a British actress, former model and singer. She played Georgina Worsley in the ITV drama series Upstairs, Downstairs, Stephanie Rogers in the CBS drama series Dallas, Olivia Richards in the NBC series Sunset Beach and Jackie Marone in the CBS soap opera The Bold and the Beautiful.

[[Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa]]

CATEGORIES: 1950 births, Living people, Naturalized citizens of the United States, Japanese movie actors, Japanese television actors, Japanese voice actors, Japanese stage actors, Japanese movie producers, American movie producers, American movie actors, American television actors, American stage actors, American voice actors, Russian movie producers, Russian movie actors, Russian television actors, Russian stage actors, Russian voice actors, Martial artists, Actors from Tokyo, Actors who played in James Bond movies

Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa (Japanese: 田川 洋行, Tagawa Hiroyuki; born September 27, 1950) is a Japanese American actor, movie producer and martial artist. He is also a Russian citizen. He played Chang in The Last Emperor, Morishi in Babylon 5, the voice of Sin Tzu for the video game Batman: Rise of Sin Tzu, and the evil mastermind Heihachi Mishima in Tekken. He played Nobusuke Tagomi in The Man in the High Castle television show.

[[Breanna Yde]]

CATEGORIES: American actors, 2003 births

Breanna Nicole Yde (born June 11, 2003) is an American child actor. She played Frankie Hathaway on the television show The Haunted Hathaways, Tomika on School of Rock, Zoey in the television film Santa Hunters, Akimi in Escape from Mr. Lemoncello's Library, and Gina on the Netflix television show Malibu Rescue.

[[Janet Lilly]]

CATEGORIES: 1957 births, American dancers, American choreographers, Actors from Iowa City, Iowa, Living people

Janet Lilly (born August 15, 1957) is an American modern dancer and choreographer. She was a principal dancer for a company from 1983 to 1991. She is now at University of North Carolina at Greensboro college of visual and performing arts.

Lilly was born in Iowa City, Iowa.

[[Daneliya Tuleshova]]

CATEGORIES: 2006 births, Living people

Daneliya Tuleshova (Danelııa Tóleshova, born 18 July 2006) is a Kazakh singer. She represented Kazakhstan in the Junior Eurovision Song Contest 2018 in Minsk, Belarus with her song "Ózińe sen", finishing sixth.

Before Junior Eurovision, she won the fourth season of The Voice Kids Ukraine and was a finalist in Children's New Wave 2015. In 2019, she took part in The World's Best, representing her country alongside Dimash Kudaibergen. She was a finalist on season 15 of America's Got Talent.

[[Lizzy Greene]]

CATEGORIES: 2003 births, Living people, Actors from Dallas, Texas, American child actors, American television actors

Lizzy Greene resume photoElizabeth Anne Greene (born May 1, 2003) is an American actress. She played Dawn Harper in the Nickelodeon show Nicky, Ricky, Dicky & Dawn from 2014 to 2018. She has been playing Sophie Dixon in the ABC family drama A Million Little Things since 2018.

[[Kathryn Bernardo]]

CATEGORIES: 1996 births, Filipino actors

Kathryn Chandria Manuel Bernardo (born March 26, 1996) is a Filipina actor who became known for playing Mara in the TV show Mara Clara (2010–2011). She has also starred in other TV shows Princess and I (2012–2013), Got to Believe (2013–2014), Pangako Sa 'Yo (2015–2016), and La Luna Sangre (2017–2018). She has also starred in different films such as Way Back Home (2011), Must Be... Love (2013), She's Dating the Gangster (2014), Crazy Beautiful You (2015), Barcelona: A Love Untold (2016), Can't Help Falling in Love (2017), The Hows of Us (2018), Three Words to Forever (2018), and Hello, Love, Goodbye (2019).

[[Fulwell]]

CATEGORIES: Areas of London, London Borough of Richmond

Fulwell is an area in the London Borough of Richmond upon Thames in outer South West London.

[[Isabela Moner]]

CATEGORIES: 2001 births, American actors

Isabela Moner (born July 10, 2001), also known as Isabela Merced, is an American actor  and singer. She played the lead role of CJ Martin on the Nickelodeon television show 100 Things to Do Before High School. In movies, she played Izabella in Transformers: The Last Knight (2017), Lizzy in Instant Family (2018), and Isabel in Sicario: Day of the Soldado (2018). In 2019, Moner played Dora in the movie Dora and the Lost City of Gold. From 2014 to 2017, she was the voice of Kate in Nickelodeon's animated television show Dora and Friends: Into the City!.

[[Summer Walker]]

CATEGORIES: 1996 births, Singers from Atlanta, Georgia, American contemporary R&B singers, Living people

Summer M. Walker (born April 11, 1996) is an American singer-songwriter. She is signed to Interscope Records and Love Renaissance, the latter is a record label. Her commercial mixtape, Last Day of Summer, was released on October 19, 2018. Her first studio album, Over It, was released on October 4, 2019. It got high marks from musical critics.

At the Soul Train Music Awards in 2019, Walker was the recipient for the Best New Artist.

Walker was discovered by a woman under exactly the same name as her (the singer). The other Summer Walker works at the Love Renaissance music studio.

Walker (the singer) was born in Atlanta, Georgia.

[[Terence Trent D'Arby]]

CATEGORIES: 1962 births, African-American singers, American singer-songwriters, American contemporary R&B singers, Singers from New York City, Musicians from Manhattan, Living people

Terence Trent Howard (later Terence Trent D'Arby; born March 15, 1962) is an American singer-songwriter. He became famous with his first studio album, Introducing the Hardline According to Terence Trent D'Arby in 1987. 

D'Arby had hit songs including "Dance Little Sister", "Sign Your Name" and the #1 hit "Wishing Well".

D'Arby was born in Manhattan, New York City.

[[1972 UEFA Cup Final]]

CATEGORIES: 1972 in sports, 20th century in London, 1970s in the United Kingdom, UEFA, Sport in London

The 1972 UEFA Cup Final was the final of the first edition of the UEFA Cup. It was played between English teams Tottenham Hotspur and Wolverhampton Wanderers. This was the first final in UEFA competition where 2 teams from the same country reached the final.

[[Truckee, California]]

CATEGORIES: Cities in California, Nevada County, California

Truckee is a city in the U.S. state of California. The city is in the northeast part of the state.

[[Scarlet Spencer]]

CATEGORIES: American television actors, Living people, American movie actors, American child actors, 2007 births

Scarlet Sofia Spencer (born February 28, 2007) is a child actress in the United States. She played Ivy in the Nickelodeon sitcom series Cousins for Life, Xan in Netflix Shameless, and Izzy in the Netflix series BlackAF.

[[Jean Louisa Kelly]]

CATEGORIES: 1972 births, American television actors, American musical theatre actors, American movie actors, Actors from Massachusetts, People from Worcester, Massachusetts, Living people

Jean Louisa Kelly (born March 9, 1972) is an American actress and singer. She played Tia Russell in Uncle Buck, a 1989  comedy-drama movie. She later acted in Mr. Holland's Opus (1995). From 2000 to 2006, Kelly played Kim Warner in CBS' sitcom Yes, Dear.

Kelly also guest starred in shows, like Mad About You, Cold  Feet and Burn Notice.

Kelly was born in Worcester, Massachusetts.

[[Lisa Ray]]

CATEGORIES: 1972 births, Canadian television actors, Canadian movie actors, Canadian models, Actors from Toronto, Living people

Lisa Ray (born 4 April 1972) is an Indian-Canadian actress. She began her modelling career in the early 1990s. She appeared for leading brands, such as Lamké and Bombay Dyeing. She began acting in 1996 with the Tamil language action movie Nethaji. Her first Bollywood appearance was the 2001 romantic-thriller movie Kasoor. 

In 2009 Ray was diagnosed with the blood cancer multiple myeloma. She began writing The Yellow Diaries, a blog about her experiences with cancer. She is an active advocate for stem cell therapy. Ray has participated in several fundraisers and cancer awareness campaigns.

In 2011 Ray began hosting a popular travel show on Discovery Channel India. She also appeared as judge and host in Food Network's Top Chef Canada. 

In March 2019 Ray participated as a panelist on the 2019 edition of Canada Reads. She worked for David Chariandy's award-winning second novel Brother.

Ray was born in Toronto, Ontario.

[[Lacey Turner]]

CATEGORIES: 1988 births, English television actors, Award winning actors, Actors from London, Living people

Lacey Turner (born 28 March 1988) is an English actress. She is known for her playing Stacey Slater in the BBC soap opera EastEnders. She won over 30 awards for that role, including ten British Soap Awards and four National Television Awards. In 2012 she played Ellie Flint in the British television show Bedlam. In 2013-2014 she played Molly Dawes in the television show Our Girl.

Turner was born in North London, England.

[[Keshia Chanté]]

CATEGORIES: 1988 births, Singers from Toronto, R&B musicians, Canadian television actors, Actors from Toronto, Actors from Ottawa, Living people

Keshia Chanté Harper (born June 16, 1988) is a Canadian singer, actress and television personality. She released her first hits as a teenager. She released four studio albums. In 2013 she rose to international fame as the co-host of BET's 106 & Park with the rapper Bow Wow. That launched her career as television host and personality.

Chanté is a Juno Award winner and seven-time nominee. She won five Canadian Urban Music Awards and two Canadian Radio Music Awards. She was given a star on the Brampton Arts Walk of Fame for her achievements in Canadian movies and music.

Chanté had a number of #1 singles on radio in both Canada and Japan. She also had eight Top Ten songs on the radio music charts. Her song, "Table Dancer" hit #1 on the Billboard Japan Digital Chart and #9 on the Billboard Japan Hot 100 chart.

Chanté Harper was born in Ottawa, Ontario.

[[Din Djarin]]

CATEGORIES: Star Wars characters, Fictional characters introduced in 2019

Din Djarin, also known as The Mandalorian, is a bounty hunter in Star Wars and the main character of The Mandalorian. The Mandalorian was hired by a remnant of the Galactic Empire to capture the mysterious Grogu or "The Child" but instead decides to protect Grogu from the Empire. Din Djarin is not allowed to take off his helmet per strict rules from his people, the Mandalorians. Mando and Grogu go on many adventures together including helping protect a village with ex-rebel shock trooper Cara Dune. During the first season's penultimate episode, a former employer, Greef Karga tells Din that the Empire has overridden his town and he promises to take the bounty of The Child's head if he helps take out the Imperials. With the help of Cara Dune, Kuiil, and IG-11 the group goes to take back the town. However during the encounter the group is ambushed by Moff Gideon who has a larger forces, traps Mando and takes The Child for himself and Kuiil gets killed in the process. But IG-11 saves Grogu and an ensuing fight takes place between Mando, Greef, Cara, IG-11 and the Imperial forces. They seek help from the hidden Mandalorian covert in the tunnels of the town but instead find one Mandalorian, The Armorer who tells Mando he must deliver Grogu to other members of his kind. IG-11 sacrifices himself so the others can escape and fight off Moff Gideon in the final fight.

With a new mission to do, Din Djarin learns that another Mandalorian on Tatooine can help him locate a Jedi so they can Grogu, but only if he gets their armor back. But instead a marshal, Cobb Vanth who isn't a Mandalorian is wearing the armor but they both cut a deal for the armor. As Mando rides away a once thought dead, Boba Fett looks on at Din who is unknowingly in procession of his armor. Mando then arrives on another planet after helping the Frog Lady who promised information. Din goes on a mission with Mandalorian, Bo-Katan Kryze who tells him to seek out Ahsoka Tano. Mando goes and finds Ahsoka who tells him Grogu's real name and his past. He helps her on a mission but she refuses to train Grogu and tells Din Djarin to place The Child on a seeing stone and he will chose his path. When Mando and Grogu go do this another bounty hunter comes after them, Boba Fett had been tracking them in hopes of getting his armor back. Mando agrees to give him the armor as long as Boba and his sidekick, Fennec Shand help protect Grogu from the incoming Imperial forces. But they fail to do so and The Child is captured by the Empire but not before sending out a call to any surviving Jedi through The Force. Mando, Boba and Fennec recruit Cara to help get Grogu back and after getting the location of Moff Gideon's cruiser they head off to fight him with the help of Bo-Katan. They are met with strong resistance when they attack the cruiser and Mando duels Moff Gideon in order to get The Child.  They are eventually cornered in the command bridge by Imperial elite troopers when a single X-Wing starfighter shows up. Unknown to the others but The Child grabs at the security screen as a dark figure in a green lightsaber cuts down troopers and makes his way to the bridge. Luke Skywalker greets them and tells them he has come for The Child and he is to be trained. Grogu and Din Djarin have an emotional goodbye before he leaves.

[[Papurana arfaki]]

CATEGORIES: Animals of Oceania, Frogs

The Arfak Mountains frog or large river frog (Papurana arfaki) is a frog from Aru Island in New Guinea.

[[Eleanor Tomlinson]]

CATEGORIES: 1992 births, English television actors, English movie actors, Actors from London, Living people

Eleanor May Tomlinson (born 19 May 1992) is an English actress. She has appeared in movies. In 2013, she played Princess Isabelle in Jack the Giant Slayer. She later acted in the movies Love Wedding Repeat (2020) and Colette (2018).

In The White Queen, Tomlinson played Lady Isabel Neville.

Tomlinson was born in London, England.

[[Tapitallee]]

CATEGORIES: Settlements in New South Wales

Tapitallee is a suburb in the City of Shaolhaven in South Coast in New South Wales in Australia. It is a rural place near Shaolhaven River, 15 kilometres north-west of Nowra.

People walk and have picnics in Bangalee Reserve there. Some buildings in Tapitallee are for accomodation. Some shops, wineries, Cambewarra Estate and Lyrebird Ridge Organic Winery, are a short drive away from Tapitallee. Tapitallee Nature Reserve is also in Tapitallee.

In 2016, 612 people lived there.

[[Xander Mobus]]

CATEGORIES: American voice actors, American video game actors, Living people, Year of birth missing (living people)

Xander Mobus is an American voice actor. He is mostly known for his work in English dubs (a type of translation, where the original audio is replaced with audio in another language) of anime and video games. He is the announcer of Super Smash Bros. for Nintendo 3DS and Wii U and Super Smash Bros. Ultimate, and the voice actor of Joker in Persona 5.

[[Kerry Vincent]]

CATEGORIES: 1945 births, 2021 deaths, Australian television presenters, Chefs, Disease-related deaths in the United States

Kerry Vincent (nee Flynn; 1 June 1945 – 2 January 2021) was an Australian television personality and baker. She lived and worked in the United States. She was a judge on many Food Network shows. She was also the co-founder of the annual Oklahoma State Sugar Art Show. In 2013, she was a judge in The Great Australian Bake Off. Vincent was born in Wyalkatchem, Western Australia.

Vincent died of an illness on 2 January 2021 in Tulsa, Oklahoma. She was 75.

[[SM Town]]

CATEGORIES: Korean musicians

SM Town (also known as SMTOWN) is a collective of musicians and dancers under the South Korean company SM Entertainment. 

SM Town artists have performed at the "SM Town Live world tours" every year since 2008. These tours have attracted over 1 million viewers as of 2014.

[[Paige O'Hara]]

CATEGORIES: 1956 births, American voice actors, American musical theatre actors, American movie actors, American painters, Actors from Florida, Singers from Florida, People from Fort Lauderdale, Florida, Living people

Donna Paige Helmintoller (later known as Paige O'Hara; born May 10, 1956) is an American actress, singer, voice actress and painter. She began her career as a Broadway actress in 1983. That year, she played Ellie May Chipley in the musical Show Boat. In 1991 she had her first movie act in Disney's Beauty and the Beast. She voiced the heroine Belle in the movie and its follow-ups.

O'Hara was born in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

[[Bobby Driscoll]]

CATEGORIES: 1937 births, American television actors, American movie actors, Award winning actors, Actors from Cedar Rapids, Iowa, Deaths from heart failure, 1968 deaths

Bobby Driscoll (March 3, 1937 – March 30, 1968) was an American child actor and artist. He had a number of movie and television performances from 1943 to 1960. He acted in Walt Disney Studios' best known live action movies of that period. Those included Song of the South (1946), So Dear to My Heart (1949) and Treasure Island (1950).

Driscoll provided the voice for the title role in the 1953 movie Peter Pan. For The Window and So Dear to My Heart, Driscoll won an Academy Juvenile Award for his roles in those two movies. 

In the mid-1950s, Driscoll's acting career began to go down. He turned to guest appearances on television.

Driscoll was born in Cedar Rapids, Iowa. He died in New York City from heart failure at age 31.

[[Terry Farrell]]

CATEGORIES: 1963 births, American television actors, American movie actors, American models, Actors from Cedar Rapids, Iowa, Living people

Theresa Lee "Terry" Farrell (born November 19, 1963) is an American actress and fashion model. She played Regina "Reggie" Kostas in the television show Becker. She acted in Star Trek: Deep Space Nine. 

Farrell appeared on the Italian and German editions of Vogue. She later appeared in editorials of American Vogue.

Farrell retired from acting to concentrate on her family.

Farrell was born in Cedar Rapids, Iowa.

[[Abilly]]

Abilly is a commune in the Indre-et-Loire department and Centre-Val de Loire region in central France.

[[Seizō Fukumoto]]

CATEGORIES: 1943 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from lung cancer, Japanese movie actors, Japanese television actors, Japanese stage actors

Seizō Fukumoto (3 February 1943 – 1 January 2021) was a Japanese actor. He was born in Kyoto, Japan. He was known for his roles in Nihon no Fixer, New Battles Without Honor and Humanity and The Last Samurai.

Fukumoto died at his Kyoto home on January 1, 2021 from lung cancer, at the age of 77.

[[Pablo Hernández (cyclist)]]

CATEGORIES: 1940 births, 2021 deaths, Colombian cyclists, Olympians

Pablo Hernández (12 February 1940 – 1 January 2021) was a Colombian cyclist. He competed in the individual road race and team time trial events at the 1964 Summer Olympics. He was born in Suesca, Colombia.

Fernández died on 1 January 2021 in Pereira, Colombia at the age of 80.

[[Georg Maier]]

CATEGORIES: 1941 births, 2021 deaths, German movie actors, German stage actors, German television actors, German theatre directors

Georg Maier (27 September 1941 – 1 January 2021) was a German actor and theatre director. He was born in Grünwald, Nazi Germany. He was known for his roles in Familie Meier (1983) and Irgendwie und Sowieso (1986).

Maier died on 1 January 2021 in Munich at the age of 79.

[[Jean Panisse]]

CATEGORIES: 1928 births, 2021 deaths, French movie actors, French stage actors, French television actors, Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in France, Actors from Marseille

Jean Panisse (March 17, 1928 – January 1, 2021) was a French actor. His career began in 1952 and he retired in 2004. Panisse was born in Marseille, France. He was known for his roles in An Angel on Wheels, The Young Wolves and Perched on a Tree.

Panisse died on 1 January 2021 in Marseille from COVID-19 at the age of 92.

[[Alex Asmasoebrata]]

CATEGORIES: 1951 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from pancreatic cancer, Indonesian politicians, Racecar drivers, Deaths from heart cancer

M.A.S. Alex Asmasoebrata (23 June 1951 – 2 January 2021) was an Indonesian politician and autoracer. He was born in Jakarta, Indonesia. From 1992 to 1997, he was a member of the People's Consultative Assembly. Asmasoebrata was a member of the People's Consultative Assembly. He was a member of the Democratic Party.

Asmasoebrata died of pancreatic and heart cancer on 2 January 2021 in Jakarta at the age of 69.

[[Alexander Belov]]

CATEGORIES: 1951 births, 1978 deaths, Deaths from heart cancer, Soviet Olympic medalists, Basketball players

Alexander Alexandrovich Belov, commonly known as Sasha Belov (November 9, 1951 – October 3, 1978) was a Soviet basketball player. He played at the center position. He won a gold medal at the 1972 Summer Olympics for the Soviet national team.

Belov was named one of FIBA's 50 Greatest Players in 1991. He honored into the FIBA Hall of Fame in 2007. He was born in Leningrad, Soviet Union.

Belov died in Leningrad, on 3 October 1978, at the age of 26 from heart cancer.

[[Bernadette Isaac-Sibille]]

CATEGORIES: 1930 births, 2021 deaths, French mayors, People from Lyon

Bernadette Isaac-Sibille (30 March 1930 – 2 January 2021) was a French politician. She was born in Lyon, France. She was a member of the Union for French Democracy. She was Mayor of Lyon from 1983 to 1989. Isaac-Sibille was a member of the National Assembly from 1988 to 2002.

Isaac-Sibille died on 2 January 2021 at the age of 90.

[[Barre, Tarn]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Tarn

Barre is a commune in the Tarn department and Occitanie region in the southern France.

[[Roger Hassenforder]]

CATEGORIES: 1930 births, 2021 deaths, French cyclists, People from Grand Est, Tour de France cyclists

Roger Hassenforder (23 July 1930 – 3 January 2021) was a French professional racing cyclist. He was born in Sausheim, France. His career lasted from 1952 to 1965. He participated in the Tour de France in 1953, 1954, 1955, 1956, 1957 and 1959. 

Hassenforder died on 3 January 2021 at the age of 90.

[[Ali Taher]]

CATEGORIES: 1961 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Indonesia, Indonesian politicians

[[Alexi Laiho]]

CATEGORIES: 1979 births, 2020 deaths, Finnish singers, Finnish musicians, Finnish writers, Songwriters, Heavy metal singers, Heavy metal guitarists

Alexi Laiho (born Markku Uula Aleksi Laiho; 8 April 1979 – 29 December 2020) was a Finnish guitarist, composer, and vocalist. He was best known as the lead guitarist, lead vocalist and founding member of the melodic death metal band Children of Bodom. 

He also the guitarist for Sinergy, The Local Band and Kylähullut. He also played with Thy Serpent and Impaled Nazarene.

On January 4, 2021, it was announced that Laiho died of a long-illness the previous month, aged 41.

[[Lee Heung-kam]]

CATEGORIES: 1932 births, 2021 deaths, Chinese movie actors, Chinese television actors, Chinese stage actors

Lee Heung-kam (13 January 1932 – 4 January 2021) was a Hong Kong actress and singer. She was born in Shunde District, Guangdong. Her career began in 1948. Lee was known for her roles in Story of the White-Haired Demon Girl, Moonlight Resonance and Can't Buy Me Love.

Lee died on 4 January 2021 at a hospital in Hong Kong, aged 88.

[[Barbara Shelley]]

CATEGORIES: 1932 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in the United Kingdom, Actors from London, English movie actors, English television actors, English stage actors

Barbara Shelley (born Barbara T. Kowin; 13 February 1932 – 4 January 2021) was an English actress. Shelley was born in London. Her career lasted from 1953 to 1992. She was best known for her roles in Dracula: Prince of Darkness, Village of the Damned and Murder at Site 3.

Shelley died of problems caused by COVID-19 on 4 January 2021 in London at the age of 88.

[[Antoni Stankiewicz]]

CATEGORIES: 1935 births, 2021 deaths, Polish Roman Catholics, Roman Catholic priests, Polish lawyers, Theologians

Antoni Stankiewicz JCD (1 October 1935 – 4 January 2021) was a Polish Roman Catholic prelate, theologian and lawyer. He was Dean Emeritus of the Tribunal of the Roman Rota from 2004 to 2010. He was born in Oleszczenice, Poland. He became a priest in 1958. 

Stankiewicz died on 4 January 2021 in Rome at the age of 85.

[[2020 Petrinja earthquake]]

CATEGORIES: 2020 disasters, 2020 in Europe, 2020s disasters in Europe, December 2020 events, Earthquakes in the 2020s, History of Croatia

At 12:20 PM CET (11:20 UTC) on 29 December 2020, an earthquake of magnitude 6.4 w (6.2 l) hit the Sisak-Moslavina County, Croatia, with an epicenter 3 west-southwest of Petrinja.

Seven people were confirmed dead, while 26 others were injured, with six having serious injuries. Many buildings in Petrinja were destroyed. The mayor of Petrinja Darinko Dumbović said that half of the town has been destroyed.

[[Petrinja]]

CATEGORIES: Towns in Europe, Croatia

Petrinja (pětriːɲa) is a town in central Croatia near Sisak in the region of Banovina. It is administratively located in Sisak-Moslavina County.

On December 29, 2020, the town was damaged by a strong earthquake.

[[Papurana aurata]]

CATEGORIES: Animals of Oceania, Frogs

The Papurana aurata is a frog from Indonesia and New Guinea.

Scientists say this frog looks like Rana volkerjane.

[[Crystal the Monkey]]

CATEGORIES: 1994 births, Living people, Individual animals

Crystal (born May 6, 1994) is a female capuchin monkey and animal actress. She starred in the Disney's 1997 movie  George of the Jungle. She also played the annoying monkey Dexter in the Night at the Museum and a drug-dealing monkey in The Hangover Part II.

[[Pierfrancesco Favino]]

CATEGORIES: 1969 births, Living people, Italian movie actors, Italian television actors, Italian stage actors, Italian voice actors, Actors from Rome

Pierfrancesco Favino (pjɛːrfranˈtʃesko faˈviːno; August 24, 1969) is an Italian actor. 

He appeared in The Prince of Homburg (1997), The Last Kiss (2001), El Alamein: The Line of Fire (2002), The Keys to the House (2004), Romanzo Criminale (2005), The Unknown Woman (2006), Night at the Museum (2006), Saturn in Opposition (2007), The Chronicles of Narnia: Prince Caspian (2008), Angels & Demons (2009), World War Z (2013), Rush (2013), Suburra (2015) and The Traitor (2019).

Mizuo Peck (born August 18, 1977) is an American actress. She is best known for playing Sacagawea in the Night at the Museum movie series.

[[Kay Ullrich]]

CATEGORIES: 1943 births, 2021 deaths, Scottish politicians

Kay Ullrich (5 May 1943 – 4 January 2021) was a Scottish politician. She was a Scottish National Party Member of the Scottish Parliament for the West of Scotland region from 1999 to 2003. Ullrich was born in Prestwick, Scotland.

Ullrich died on 4 January 2021, aged 77.

[[Papurana volkerjane]]

CATEGORIES: Animals of Oceania, Frogs

The Papurana volkerjane is a frog from Indonesia and New Guinea.  Scientists saw it in the Wondiwoi Mountains between 250 and 700 meters above sea level.  They also saw it in the Bewani Mountains and Torricelli Mountains.

Scientists say this frog looks like Rana aurata.

[[Lemanu Peleti Mauga]]

CATEGORIES: 1949 births, 1950 births, Living people, Governors of American Samoa, US Democratic Party politicians, Lieutenant Governors of American Samoa

Lemanu Palepoi Sialega "Peleti" Mauga (born 1949 or 1950) is an American Samoan politician. In 2021, he became the 58th governor of American Samoa. He is a member of the Democratic Party. 

Mauga served as Senator in the American Samoa Senate, where he became the Chairman of both the Budget and Appropriations Committee and the Senate Homeland Security Committee.

[[Aiguilles]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Hautes-Alpes

Aiguilles is a commune in the Hautes-Alpes department and Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region in southeastern France.

[[Rugby, North Dakota]]

CATEGORIES: Cities in North Dakota, County seats in North Dakota

Rugby is a city in, and the county seat of, Pierce County, North Dakota, United States. 2,876 people lived here at the 2010 census. 

[[Abriès]]

CATEGORIES: Former communes in Hautes-Alpes

Abriès is a former commune in the Hautes-Alpes department and Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region in southeastern France. It is now part of Abriès-Ristolas.

[[Ristolas]]

CATEGORIES: Former communes in Hautes-Alpes

Ristolas is a former commune in the Hautes-Alpes department and Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region in southeastern France. It is now part of Abriès-Ristolas.

[[Abriès-Ristolas]]

CATEGORIES: 2019 establishments in France, Communes in Hautes-Alpes

Abriès-Ristolas is a commune in the Hautes-Alpes department and Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region in southeastern France.

It was created in 2019, when Abriès and Ristolas merged.

[[Shadoe Stevens]]

CATEGORIES: 1947 births, People from North Dakota, American television personalities, American radio personalities, Living people

Shadoe Stevens (born November 3, 1947) is an American radio host, television personality and voiceover host. He hosted the American Top 40 from August 1988 to January 1995. On television, Stevens was the announcer for The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson.

Stevens first became famous in 1957 when a Life magazine article titled "America's Youngest D.J." ran a story on him.

Stevens was born in Jamestown, North Dakota

[[Poligny, Hautes-Alpes]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Hautes-Alpes

Poligny is a commune in the Hautes-Alpes department and Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region in southeastern France.

[[American Top 40]]

CATEGORIES: American music, Record charts, Radio programs, 1970 establishments in the United States

American Top 40 (usually abbreviated to AT40) is a syndicated radio program. AT40 was created by Casey Kasem in 1970. 

The program is currently hosted by Ryan Seacrest and presented as an adjunct to his weekday radio program, On Air with Ryan Seacrest.

The radio show was originally a production for Watermark, Inc(later a member of ABC Radio known as ABC Watermark). It's currently a production of Premiere Networks.

Some of the songs played on AT40 had profanity or offensive content inside them. During the Shadoe Stevens era of AT40, 2 Live Crew's "Me So Horny" aired in autumn 1989.

Hip hop music was played on the AT40 mostly in the late 1980s and 1990s. It continues now.

In the 1970s, disco music aired on AT40.

No song began at #1. The closest to that happening was "Erotica" by Madonna in 1992.

[[Marc du Pontavice]]

CATEGORIES: 1963 births, Living people, Animators, People from Paris

Marc du Pontavice (born 10 January 1963) is a French animator who is the producer of Oggy and the cockroaches ("Oggy et les Cafards"), The Magician, Space Goofs, Kaena: The Prophecy, Mr. Baby, Les Dalton, and Ratz. He was an executive producer from Gaumont, which is based in France. After leaving the company, he, along with Alix du Pontavice founded Xilam.

[[Olivier Jean-Marie]]

CATEGORIES: 1960 births, Living people, French movie directors

Olivier Jean-Marie (born 25 April 1960) is a French animator and director of animated movies and shows. In 2007, he directed Go West: A Lucky Luke Adventure, an animated feature film of Lucky Luke. In 2010, he created and directed Zig and Sharko, a slapstick comedy, and in 2013, he wrote and directed Oggy and the Cockroaches: The Movie. Oggy and the cockroaches is one of his most famous movies. In the French comedy Oggy, a tom-cat, tries to catch three cockroaches messing about in his house.

[[Naohiro Ikeda]]

CATEGORIES: 1940 births, 2021 deaths, Japanese Olympic silver medalists, Japanese Olympic bronze medalists, Volleyball players, People from Saga Prefecture, Deaths from lymphoma

Naohiro Ikeda was a Japanese volleyball player. He competed in the 1964 Summer Olympics and in the 1968 Summer Olympics. He was born in Saga Prefecture, Japan. In 1964 he was part of the Japanese team which won the bronze medal and won the silver medal in the 1968 Olympic tournament.

Ikeda died on 3 January 2021 in Tokyo from lymphoma, aged 80.

[[Canal+ Family]]

CATEGORIES: Television stations

Canal+ Family was a French TV channel devoted to the broadcast of family programming. It is part of the "Les Chaînes Canal+" and the "Famille" package from Canal+.

Canal+ Family has an African version, on channel 6 from Canal+ Afrique.

[[Brad Raffensperger]]

CATEGORIES: 1955 births, Living people, State legislators of the United States, Politicians from Georgia (U.S. state), US Republican Party politicians, Donald Trump, Businesspeople from Georgia (U.S. state)

Bradford Jay Raffensperger (born May 18, 1955) is an American politician, businessman, and civil engineer. He is a Republican. He is the Secretary of State of Georgia since 2019. He was in the Georgia House of Representatives.

Around January 3, 2021, a scandal which had Donald Trump try to push Raffensperger to "find more votes" to make Trump the winner in Georgia over the actual winner Joe Biden.

[[Trump–Raffensperger phone call]]

CATEGORIES: January 2021 events, Donald Trump, 2020 United States presidential election, Political scandals in the United States

On January 2, 2021, former U.S. President Donald Trump called Brad Raffensperger, the Secretary of State of Georgia, for an hour-long telephone call telling him to change the state's vote totals from the 2020 presidential election. Joe Biden won the state in November. Trump has refused to accept the presidential election. 

Trump's call with Raffensperger was first reported by The Washington Post and other media outlets the day after it took place.

At one point on the call, Trump told Raffensperger, "What I want to do this. I just want to find 11,780 votes, which is one more than we have, because we won the state." Trump lost Georgia by 11,779 votes, so 11,780 votes would be 1 vote more for him.

Many believe that Trump should be criminally investigated and impeached. Many Republicans and Democrats criticized Trump's phone call.

[[James C. Renick]]

CATEGORIES: 1948 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from motor neurone disease, American academics, Writers from Illinois, Writers from North Carolina, People from Rockford, Illinois, People from Greensboro, North Carolina

James Carmichael Renick (December 8, 1948 – January 3, 2021) was an American academic. He was the Chancellor of University of Michigan–Dearborn from 1993 to 1999 and of North Carolina A&T State University from 1999 to 2006. He was born in Rockford, Illinois.

Renick died on January 3, 2021 in Greensboro, North Carolina from problems caused by amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, aged 72.

[[D-Back]]

CATEGORIES: Software

D-Back is the PC software designed by iMyFone Technology Co., Ltd. to help users recover lost or deleted data on iPhone, iPad, iPod touch, and fix iOS issues or iOS update/restore errors. It is available on both Windows and Mac systems including the free and paid versions.

It supports features such as Smart Recovery, Recover from iOS Device, Recover from iTunes Backup, Recover from iCloud Backup, Fix iOS System etc.

[[M. R. Schunker]]

CATEGORIES: 1924 births, 2021 deaths, Indian military people

Vice Admiral Melville Raymond Schunker (18 September 1924 – 4 January 2021) was an Indian Navy admiral. He was the third Director General of the Indian Coast Guard from 1982 to 1984. He also was the 6th Vice Chief of the Naval Staff (VCNS) from 1980 to 1982. 

Schunker died on 4 January 2021 at a Goa hospital at the age of 96.

[[Turbo (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 2013 animated movies, 2013 comedy movies, American animated movies, American sports comedy movies, DreamWorks Animation movies, 20th Century Fox movies, Movies about animals

Turbo is a 2013 computer-animated movie. It is directed by David Soren, written by David Soren, Robert Siegel and Darren Lemke. It stars the voices of Ryan Reynolds, Paul Giamatti, Michael Peña, Snoop Dogg, Maya Rudolph, Michelle Rodriguez and Samuel L. Jackson.

[[Kneecap (band)]]

CATEGORIES: Establishments in Northern Ireland, 2010s establishments in the United Kingdom, 2017 establishments in Europe, Hip hop bands, 2010s Irish music groups, People from Belfast, Musical groups established in the 2010s

Kneecap (spelled KNEECAP) is a hip hop band from Belfast, Northern Ireland. It has three members: Mo Chara, Móglaí Bap and DJ Próvaí. They sing in English and Irish and often show they support Irish republicanism. "C.E.A.R.T.A." (Irish for "R.I.G.H.T.S.", meaning human rights), their first song, came out in 2017. They released more singles, such as "Get Your Brits Out", then their first album, 3CAG, in 2018.

[[Benjamin Hoskins Paddock]]

CATEGORIES: 1926 births, 1998 deaths, American robbers, American fraudsters, People from Wisconsin

Benjamin Hoskins Paddock Jr. was an American bank robber and con man who was on the FBI's Ten Most Wanted Fugitives from 1969 to 1977. He was the father of the 2017 Las Vegas shooting suspect Stephen Paddock, but never knew him.

[[Single point of failure]]

CATEGORIES: Systems theory, Control engineering

When looking at a technical system, a single point of failure is a component that will stop the whole system from working if it fails. Systems that are built for high availability or reliability usually are designed to avoid single point of failures. This is usually done by adding redundancy, which is more than one thing that can do the same work. 

[[IG-11]]

CATEGORIES: Star Wars characters, Fictional characters introduced in 2019

IG-11 is a assassin droid from Star Wars. IG-11 has made multiple appearances in the television show The Mandalorian. During a mission to collect a bounty, Din Djarin and IG-11 worked together to collect it. But when IG-11 attempted to kill the bounty, the Mandalorian shot him in the head and nearly destroying him. But after the encounter, IG-11 was saved and rebuilt into a nurse droid by Kuiil. When Din Djarin recruits Kuiil and IG-11 for a mission, IG-11 is tasked with protecting Grogu. During the mission Kuiil is killed and Grogu is taken captive. But IG-11 comes by to quickly take back Grogu and skirmish with the Imperial forces. Pinned down in a tavern, IG-11 heals Din Djarin's head wounds while the others escape. Eventually, the group takes a boat down a lava stream to the lava flats but a platoon of stormtroopers. IG-11 sacrifices himself by self- destruction, killing the stormtroopers and giving Mando and his group the ability to escape. IG-11 is the same model as IG-88 and is voiced by Taika Waititi. 

[[The Mandalorian]]

CATEGORIES: 2019 television series debuts, 2010s American television series, American science fiction television series, Action television series, Star Wars series, English-language television programs

The Mandalorian is an American space western set in the Star Wars fictional universe. The show is created by Jon Favreau and is the first live-action Star Wars show. The Mandalorian takes place five years after Star Wars Episode VI: Return of the Jedi and twenty-five years before Star Wars: The Force Awakens. The show follows lone bounty hunter Din Djarin as he travels the galaxy with Grogu, protecting him from the grasp of the remaining Galactic Empire. Jon Favreau was announced as the series series writer on March 2018 as the first Star Wars show to premier on Disney+. The show has received immense praise for its take on Star Wars which promoted the green light for a second season which premiered on Disney+ October 30, 2020.

[[Obradoiro Club de Amigos do Baloncesto]]

CATEGORIES: 1970 establishments in Europe, 1970s establishments in Spain, Basketball teams, Sport in Spain, Santiago de Compostela

Obradoiro Club de Amigos do Baloncesto is a Galician basketball team. It was founded in 1970. The team currently plays in league ACB.

[[Cara Dune]]

CATEGORIES: Star Wars characters, Fictional characters introduced in 2019

Cara Dune is a Star Wars character. She is in many episodes of The Mandalorian. Cara was first a shock trooper for the Rebel Alliance. She went to fight Imperials after the Battle of Endor. She also helped create the New Republic. She became a mercenary after and moved around the galaxy. She became a marshall. 

After a fight with Din Djarin and Grogu, Cara agreed to help protect a village from raiders with them. They train the villagers to fight and set up a protection against the raiders. Raiders came to attack the village. Cara and Din help the villagers win. Then, the Mandalorian and Cara each leave and go to different places. Later on, Din Djarin asks for help from Cara Dune to help fight off Imperials at the request of Greef Karga. While on Mando's ship, Grogu force chokes Cara Dune because he thought that Cara was attacking Djarin when they were arm-wrestling. When the fighting begins between Cara, Mando, Din, IG-11 and the Empire they are pinned down but Cara manages to find an escape through the tunnels. After they get out of the tunnels they are attacked by Moff Gideon in his TIE fighter which Cara helps repel. Cara is then invited to work as an enforcer with Greef which she agrees to.

She helps Din Djarin and Greef Karga blow up an Imperial base. They learn that Moff Gideon is trying to clone something or someone at the base. They set the base to blow up and steal a vehicle to escape. Stormtroopers on speederbikes and TIE fighters try to stop them but they escape. Later on, Cara agrees to help Mando find Grogu after he is taken by Moff Gideon. She is waiting and ready as Mando and prisoner Migs Mayfeld find Gideon's ship. Soon after Cara, Mando, Bo-Katan Kyrze, Fennec Shand and Koska Reeves attack the ship and take it over. They free Grogu and capture Gideon. But Imperial soldiers trap them when one X-Wing starfighter comes. Cara says jokingly, that they are saved, but she does not know that it was Luke Skywalker who came to save them.

[[Simon Warr]]

Simon Warr (9 September 1953 - 22 February 2020) was a British radio performer and teacher.  He was famous for performing as headmaster in That'll Teach Em.

[[Charlestown, Saint Kitts and Nevis]]

CATEGORIES: Towns in North America, Saint Kitts and Nevis

Charlestown is a town on the island of Nevis (St. Kitts and Nevis).

[[C/1980 E1]]

CATEGORIES: Comets

C/1980 E1 is a non-periodic comet discovered by Edward L. G. Bowell on 11 February 1980 and came closest to the Sun in March 1982. It is leaving the Solar System due to a close approach to Jupiter.  Since its discovery only 1I/ʻOumuamua and 2I/Borisov have been identified with a faster trajectory.

[[Ethnography]]

CATEGORIES: Ethnography, Anthropology

Ethnography is a kind of anthropology. Ethnographers study specific cultures.

Ethnography mostly uses participant observation. The researcher becomes part of the setting or mixes with the people being studied. They try to record patterns of social interaction and the thoughts and experiences of participants. Ethnographers want to understand these in their local contexts. Ethnography started in social and cultural anthropology in the early twentieth century. It spread to other social sciences, especially sociology.

Ethnographers mainly use qualitative methods. They may also use quantitative data. 

According to Dewan (2018), ethnographers do not try to find generalized results. They study cultures in context and in a specific situation. The best way to use ethnography with quantitative research is to discover relationships. Then, use the results and data to test and explain empirical assumptions.

The word ethnography comes from Greek words ἔθνος ethnos "folk, people, nation" and γράφω grapho "I write")

[[Flight Command]]

CATEGORIES: 1940 movies, 1940s romance movies, 1940s drama movies, American romantic drama movies, MGM movies, Movies directed by Frank Borzage

Flight Command is a 1940 American romantic drama movie directed by Frank Borzage and starring Robert Taylor, Ruth Hessey, Walter Pidgeon, Red Skelton, Nat Pendleton, Dick Purcell, Addison Richards, Marsha Hunt, Pat Flaherty. It was distributed by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and was nominated for an Academy Award in 1942.

[[Avocado toast]]

CATEGORIES: Sandwiches, Australian culture, Avocados

Avocado toast is a type of open sandwich. It is toast with mashed avocado, salt, black pepper, and lemon juice. Many other ingredients may be used, such as poached eggs, salmon, strawberries, tomato, and feta. It is a dish popularised in Australia.

[[Leave Her to Heaven]]

CATEGORIES: 1945 movies, 1940s crime movies, 1940s thriller movies, American crime thriller movies, Movies based on books, 20th Century Fox movies, Movies directed by John M. Stahl

Leave Her to Heaven is a 1945 American crime thriller movie directed by John M. Stahl and was based on the 1944 novel of the same name by Ben Ames Williams. It stars Gene Tierney, Cornel Wilde, Jeanne Crain, Vincent Price, Mary Philips, Gene Lockhart, Darryl Hickman, Reed Hadley and was distributed by 20th Century Fox. It was nominated for 4 Oscars and won an Academy Award in 1946.

[[The Musk Who Fell to Earth]]

CATEGORIES: The Simpsons (season 26) episodes, 2015 television episodes, Elon Musk

"The Musk Who Fell to Earth" is the 12th episode of the 26th season of The Simpsons. It was first shown on the Fox network on January 25, 2015. Elon Musk is a guest star in the episode. 

[[Franco Loi]]

CATEGORIES: 1930 births, 2021 deaths, Italian poets, Essayists, People from Genoa

Franco Loi (21 January 1930 – 4 January 2021) was an Italian poet, writer, and essayist. He was born in Genoa, Italy. In 2001, Loi wrote a book of short stories The width of the sky and published several essays. Loi was the winner of the Bonfiglio Prize for the Stròlegh collection.

Loi died on 4 January 2021 in Milan at the age of 90.

[[Sandra Hutchens]]

CATEGORIES: 1955 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from breast cancer, American police officers, Politicians from California, People from Orange County, California

Sandra Sue Hutchens (March 18, 1955 – January 4, 2021) was an American law enforcement official and politician. She was the Sheriff-Coroner of Orange County, California from 2008 to 2019. Hutchens was born in Monterey Park, California. 

Hutchens died on January 4, 2021 from breast cancer in Temecula, California, aged 65.

[[Elena Santiago]]

CATEGORIES: 1941 births, 2021 deaths, Spanish writers

Elena Fernández Gómez (8 February 1941 – 3 January 2021), known by the pen name Elena Santiago, was a Spanish writer. She was born in Castile and León, Spain. In 1983, she won the Felipe Trigo Awards. She wrote many Christmas-related children stories. She wrote Cuentos de este siglo, Cien años de cuento, El Faro, Miguel Delibes, and Jorge Guillén. 

Santiago died at the age of 79 on 3 January 2021 in Valladolid, Spain.

[[Lee Breuer]]

CATEGORIES: 1937 births, 2021 deaths, American playwrights, American theatre directors, American academics, American poets, American songwriters, Writers from New York City

Lee Breuer (February 6, 1937 – January 3, 2021) was an American playwright, theater director, academic, educator, filmmaker, poet, and lyricist. Breuer taught and directed on six continents. Breuer was a founding co-artistic director of Mabou Mines Theater Company in New York City. 

Breuer died on January 3, 2021 at the age of 83.

[[Guadalupe Grande]]

CATEGORIES: 1965 births, 2021 deaths, Spanish poets, Spanish educators, Critics

Guadalupe Grande (30 May 1965 – 2 January 2021) was a Spanish poet. She had a degree in social anthropology from the Complutense University of Madrid. She was born in Madrid. She was a literary critic and teacher. She wrote El libro de Lilit in 1995, La llave de la niebla in 2003, and Mapas de cera in 2006.

Grande died on 2 January 2021 in Madrid at the age of 55.

[[Paatje Phefferkorn]]

CATEGORIES: 1922 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in the Netherlands, Dutch sportspeople, Indonesian people, Mixed martial artists

Verdi Phefferkorn von Offenbach (26 February 1922 – 1 January 2021), better known as ‘Paatje Phefferkorn’, was an Indonesian-Dutch  practitioner and mixed martial artist. He was born in Bandung, Dutch East Indies. He was the creator of the 'Indo Melati' flag and emblem. In 1967 he started a small mixed martial arts school in the city of Utrecht. Soon he created a second school and in the end ran 17 schools throughout the Netherlands.

Phefferkorn died due to COVID-19 on 1 January 2021 in Amsterdam at the age of 98.

[[Allen Covert]]

CATEGORIES: 1964 births, Living people, American movie actors, American television actors, American voice actors, Actors from Florida, Writers from Florida, American screenwriters, Businesspeople from Florida, American movie producers

Allen Stephen Covert (born October 13, 1964) is an American comedian, actor, writer, and producer. He is best known for his starring role in the classic 2006 comedy movie Grandma's Boy. He was born in West Palm Beach, Florida.

He was in many movies with actor and friend Adam Sandler such as Happy Gilmore (1996), The Wedding Singer (1998), Big Daddy (1999), Little Nicky (2000), Mr. Deeds (2002), Anger Management (2003), 50 First Dates (2004) and I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry (2007).

Christine Elizabeth Woods (born September 3, 1983) is an American actress. She appeared in the HBO series Hello Ladies. She played FBI Special Agent Janis Hawk in the ABC series FlashForward.

Lake Forest is a city in Orange County, California. 77,264 people lived here at the 2010 census.

[[Laura Harring]]

Laura Elena, Countess von Bismarck-Schönhausen (née Martínez-Herring; March 3, 1964), commonly known as Laura Harring, is a Mexican-American actress and model.

In 1985, Harring became the first Hispanic woman crowned Miss USA. She is best known for her roles as Rita and Camilla Rhodes in the 2001 movie Mulholland Drive.

[[John Muckler]]

CATEGORIES: 1934 births, 2021 deaths, Ice hockey people from Canada, Canadian businesspeople, People from Ontario

John Muckler (April 13, 1934 – January 4, 2021) was a Canadian professional hockey coach and executive. He was a manager and executive for many National Hockey League (NHL) teams. He had been a part of five Stanley Cup championships. He managed the Minnesota North Stars, Edmonton Oilers, Buffalo Sabres, New York Rangers, Ottawa Senators and Phoenix Coyotes. Muckler was born in Midland, Ontario.

Muckler died on January 4, 2021 in Buffalo, New York at the age of 86.

[[Midland, Ontario]]

CATEGORIES: Towns in Ontario

Midland is a town on Georgian Bay in Simcoe County, Ontario, Canada.  It is part of the Huronia/Wendat region of Central Ontario.

[[Alienation (Marxism)]]

CATEGORIES: Social sciences, Marxism

In Marxism, alienation is a feeling that people have when they don't feel connected to the society around them and their work.

According to Marx, there are four types of alienation in a capitalist society:

Because of alienation, people have no control over their lives or over the things they make. Instead, the products of their labor are exchanged for wages in order to survive.

[[Ethel Byrne]]

CATEGORIES: 1883 births, 1955 deaths, Pages with unreviewed translations, Activists

Ethel Higgins Byrne (1883-1955) was an American Progressive Era radical feminist. She was the younger sister of birth control activist Margaret Sanger, and assisted her in this work.

[[Primitive communism]]

CATEGORIES: Communism

Primitive communism is a term that was used by Karl Marx and Fredrich Engels to describe hunter-gatherer societies and how they shared resources among each other. Primitive means in the early stages of development, so primitive communism is an early form of communism.

[[Cypriot First Division]]

The Cypriot First Division is the top division of association football in Cyprus. It is organized by the Cyprus Football Association. Since February 2016, it is sponsored by Cyta and thus officially known as Cyta Championship.

[[Spanish grammar]]

CATEGORIES: Spanish language, Grammar

Spanish grammar is the rules for speaking and writing in the Spanish language. It is similar to the grammar of other Romance languages.

[[False confession]]

CATEGORIES: Law

In law, a confession is when somebody admits that he or she has committed a crime or a felony, which is punishable. In a false confession, the person admits he or she has committed a crime or a felony, but this is not true. False confessions occur regularly. In general, there are three reasons, why they occur:

[[Steve Russell (computer scientist)]]

CATEGORIES: 1937 births, Living people, American computer scientists, People from Hartford, Connecticut

Stephen Russell (born 1937), also nicknamed "Slug", is an American computer scientist. He is best known for creating Spacewar! (1962), one of the earliest video games. He wrote the first two versions of the programming language Lisp for the IBM 704 mainframe computer. 

Russell was born in Hartford, Connecticut. He went to Dartmouth College in Hanover, New Hampshire, from 1954 to 1958.

[[Lynn Morley Martin]]

CATEGORIES: 1939 births, Living people, Businesspeople from Illinois, People from Evanston, Illinois, United States representatives from Illinois, United States Secretaries of Labor, US Republican Party politicians

Lynn Morley Martin (born Judith Lynn Morley; December 26, 1939) is an American politician and businesswoman. She is a Republican. She was the United States Secretary of Labor from 1991 to 1993. She also served as a member of the U.S. House of Representatives from Illinois's 16th congressional district from 1981 to 1991.

Martin was born in Evanston, Illinois. She had two children with her first husband John Martin. In 1987, she married judge Harry Leinenweber.

[[Papurana daemeli]]

CATEGORIES: Animals of Asia, Frogs, Animals of Australia

The Australian bullfrog, Australian wood frog, water frog, Arhem Rana or wood frog (Papurana daemeli) is a frog from New Guinea and Australia.  It lives everywhere in New Guinea up to 1000 meters above sea level.  It lives in northern Queensland on the Cape York Peninsula and in the Northern Territory.  The Australian bullfrog is the only true frog that lives in Australia.  Scientists think the frog traveled to Australia from New Guinea.

This frog lives in rainforests, monsoon forests and other tropical forests.  It lives near bodies of water that do not dry up.  The frog hides in plants near the water.  The female lays thousands of eggs at a time.

This frog can be as large as 8.0 cm from head to end of the body.  It has a pointed head.  It can be light brown or dark brown.  It has two folds of skin down its back.

[[Wyalkatchem]]

CATEGORIES: Towns in Western Australia

Wyalkatchem is a town in the Wheatbelt region of Western Australia. At the 2018 census, 498 people lived in the town.

[[Bob Brett]]

CATEGORIES: 1953 births, 2021 deaths, Cancer deaths in France, Coaches, Sportspeople from Melbourne, Tennis

Bob Brett (13 November 1953 – 5 January 2021) was an Australian tennis coach. He coached Boris Becker. Becker won Wimbledon, the US Open and the Australian Open between 1989 and 1991 while Brett was his coach. Brett also coached Goran Ivanišević, Andrei Medvedev, Mario Ančić, Marin Čilić, and others. Brett spent 24 years on the ATP circuit. He was born in Melbourne, Victoria.

Brett died of cancer in Paris on 5 January 2021. He was 67.

[[Guillermo Rodríguez Melgarejo]]

CATEGORIES: 1943 births, 2021 deaths, Roman Catholic priests, Roman Catholic bishops, People from Buenos Aires

Guillermo Rodríguez Melgarejo (20 May 1943 – 4 January 2021) was an Argentine Roman Catholic bishop. Melgarejo was born in Buenos Aires, Argentina. He became a priest in 1970. 

Melgarejo was titular bishop of Ucres and as auxiliary bishop of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Buenos Aires from 1994 to 2003 and as bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of San Martín in Argentina from 2003 to 2018.

Melgarejo died on 4 January 2021, aged 77.

[[3D/Biela]]

CATEGORIES: Comets

Biela's Comet or Comet Biela (official designation: 3D/Biela) was a periodic comet first recorded in 1772 by Montaigne and Messier and finally identified as periodic in 1826 by Wilhelm von Biela.  It was seen to split in two and has not been seen since 1852. It is thought to have been destroyed, although remnants appeared to have survived for some time as a meteor shower, the Andromedids.

[[Kim Tschang-yeul]]

CATEGORIES: 1929 births, 2021 deaths, Painters, People from Seoul

Kim Tschang Yeul (also known as "김창열","Kim Tchangyeul", "Kim Chang Yeul", or "Tschangyeul Kim"; 24 December 1929 – 5 January 2021) was a South Korean painter. He was born in Maengsan, South Pyongan. Many of his works were surrealism and about spirituality.

In 2016, the government of Jeju Province opened the Kim Tschang Yeul Art Museum in Artists' Village in Jeoji, Jeju island, South Korea. It was the highest honor given to a living Korean artist.

In 2017, he was awarded the Officier medal of the Ordre des Arts et des Lettres by the Embassy of France in Seoul. 

Kim died on 5 January 2021 in Seoul at the age of 91.

The Ordre des Arts et des Lettres (Order of Arts and Letters) is an order of France created on 2 May 1957 by the Minister of Culture. Its status to the Ordre national du Mérite was confirmed by President Charles de Gaulle in 1963.

The Order has three grades:

[[Praia Grande]]

CATEGORIES: Municipalities in São Paulo (state)

Praia Grande (ˌpɾajjaˈɡɾɐ̃dʒi is a municipality in the state of São Paulo in Brazil. It is part of the Metropolitan Region of Baixada Santista. 319,146 people lived here in 2018.

[[Anatoliy Butenko]]

CATEGORIES: 1938 births, 2021 deaths, Ukrainian politicians

Anatoliy Ivanovych Butenko (23 February 1938 – 4 January 2021) was a Ukrainian politician. He was born in Myrhorod, Ukraine. He was a member of the Communist Party of Ukraine. From 1990 to 1994, he was a member of the Verkhovna Rada.

Butenko died on 4 January 2021, aged 82.

[[Gordon "Butch" Stewart]]

CATEGORIES: 1941 births, 2021 deaths, Jamaican businesspeople

Gordon Arthur Cyril Stewart OJ, CD (6 July 1941 – 4 January 2021), commonly known as Butch Stewart, was a Jamaican hotelier and businessman. He was the founder, owner and chairman of Sandals Resorts, Beaches Resorts. He also owned The Jamaica Observer. He was born in Kingston, Jamaica.

Stewart died in Miami, Florida on 4 January 2021 at the age of 79.

[[Lotte Lenya]]

CATEGORIES: 1898 births, 1981 deaths, Actors from Vienna, Actors who played Bond villains, American movie actors, American musical theatre actors, American singers, Austrian movie actors, Austrian singers, Austrian stage actors, Cancer deaths in New York City, Naturalized citizens of the United States

Lotte Lenya (born Karoline Wilhelmine Charlotte Blamauer; 18 October 1898 – 27 November 1981) was an Austrian–American singer, and actress. 

She sang Kurt Weill's songs. He was her first husband. She married him twice.

In English-language cinema, she was nominated for an Academy Award for playing an aristocrat in The Roman Spring of Mrs. Stone (1961). 

Her performance as the murderous and sadistic Rosa Klebb in the James Bond movie From Russia with Love (1963) is famous.

[[Mikhail Zhelev]]

CATEGORIES: 1943 births, 2021 deaths, Competitors in athletics, Olympians

Mikhail Zhelev (Михаил Желев) (15 July 1943 – 5 January 2021) was a Bulgarian athlete. He was born in Sliven, Bulgaria. He competed in the 1968 Summer Olympics, finishing 6th and in the 1972 Summer Olympics, finishing 12th. He won a gold medal at the 1969 European Athletics Championships.

Zhelev died on 5 January 2021 at the age of 77.

[[James Greene (Northern Irish actor)]]

CATEGORIES: 1931 births, 2021 deaths, British movie actors, British television actors, British stage actors, People from Belfast

James Greene (19 May 1931 – January 2021) was a Northern Irish actor. He played lawyers, clergymen, army officers and judges on many movies and television shows. He was born in Belfast, Northern Ireland. He played Scottish clergyman in Johnny English (2003), Roy in the medial drama Holby City and as Mr. Hubble in Big School.

Greene died in January 2021, aged 89.

[[El Capitan]]

CATEGORIES: Geological formations, Landforms of California, Mariposa County, California

El Capitan (El Capitán; The Captain or The Chief), also known as El Cap, is a vertical rock formation in Yosemite National Park. It is on the north side of Yosemite Valley, near its western end. The granite monolith is about 3,000 from base to top along its tallest face. Many rock climbers go up the mountain

A person first climbed El Capitan in 1958.

[[João Cutileiro]]

CATEGORIES: 1937 births, 2021 deaths, Deaths from respiratory failure, Sculptors, Portuguese artists, People from Lisbon

João Cutileiro OSE (26 June 1937 – 5 January 2021) was a Portuguese modernist sculptor. He created controversial female nude marble statues. He was born in Lisbon. One of his important works is the statue of Sebastian of Portugal (1973) in the Algarve. 

Cutileiro died of respiratory failure on 5 January 2021 in Lisbon, aged 83.

[[Carly Chaikin]]

CATEGORIES: 1990 births, Living people, American movie actors, American television actors, American stage actors, American voice actors, Actors from Santa Monica, California

Carly Hannah Chaikin (born March 26, 1990) is an American actress. Her acting career began in 2009. She played Dalia Royce in the ABC sitcom Suburgatory. She played the role until the series' cancellation in 2014. She also played Darlene in the USA Network thriller drama series Mr. Robot.

[[Frankie Shaw]]

CATEGORIES: 1986 births, Living people, American movie actors, American television actors, American voice actors, American stage actors, American television writers, American television directors, Comedians from Massachusetts, Actors from Boston, Massachusetts, Writers from Boston, Massachusetts, American television producers, People from Brookline, Massachusetts

Rachel Frances Shaw (born 1981) is an American actress, writer, director and producer. She played Bridgette Bird on the Showtime series SMILF. 

Shaw also played Mary Jo Cacciatore on the 2010–2011 Spike TV series Blue Mountain State, and her role as Shayla Nico in the first season of the USA Network television series Mr. Robot.

[[Wood frog (disambiguation)]]

Wood frog is the ordinary speech name for many species of frog.

[[Estadio Multiusos de San Lázaro]]

CATEGORIES: Football stadiums in Spain, Santiago de Compostela

Estadio Municipal Vero Boquete de San Lázaro, formerly called Estadio Multiusos de San Lázaro, is a multi-purpose stadium in Santiago de Compostela, Spain. It is used mostly for football matches and is the home ground of SD Compostela. It has a capacity of 16,666 and the pitch dimensions are 105.

[[Bart's New Friend]]

CATEGORIES: The Simpsons (season 26) episodes, 2015 television episodes

"Bart's New Friend" is the 11th episode of the 26th season of The Simpsons. It was first shown on the Fox network on January 11, 2015. In the episode, Homer gets hypnotized and now thinks he is a child.

[[IFP School]]

CATEGORIES: Technical colleges and universities in France, 1954 establishments in Europe, 1950s establishments in France

IFP School (École nationale supérieure du pétrole et des moteurs) is a renowned graduate engineering school in France. It is in a campus of IFP Énergies nouvelles.

Its different curricula lead to the following French & European degrees:

Academic activities and industrial applied research are performed mainly in French and English languages. Students from a dozen of nationalities participate to the different curricula at IFP School.

Most of the 800 graduate engineer students at IFP live in dedicated residential buildings nearby research labs and metro public transports.

[[MK2]]

CATEGORIES: Dwarf planets

MK2  is a moon of the dwarf planet Makemake. It was discovered in 2016. Its orbital period around Makemake is around 12 days. It is about 175 kilometers across.

[[Pennsylvania Dutch]]

Pennsylvania Dutch is the name of a group of settlers who emigrated to the United States. Most of them were Protestant, they travelled along the Rhine, to reach the sea. Most of them settled in Pennsylvania. Most of them were Mennonites, Amish, or they belonged to the Moravian Church. They kept their language, which is known as Pennsylvania Dutch today. There numbers are unknown, but based on the speakers of the language, they are estimated to be between 390,000 and 420,000 people. About 80% of the people are Amish or Old Order Mennonites. Lutherans and Protestants only account for about five percent of the speakers. 

[[GoldenEye 007]]

GoldenEye 007 may mean:

[[List of awards and nominations received by Michael Jackson]]

Michael Jackson (1958–2009) was an American singer, songwriter, dancer and film maker. Starting his career at the age of 5 and ending it with his death, Jackson has many awards. So many awards that today he is called the "King of Pop" and greatest entertainer of all time.

During Jackson's career, he earned 13 Grammy Awards, the Grammy Legend Award and Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award; 6 Brit Awards, 5 Billboard Music Awards and 24 American Music Awards. Right now, he holds 16 Guinness World Records. He is a member of the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, becoming one of few artists to be admitted twice (he was admitted in 1997 as a member of The Jackson 5 and again as a solo artist in 2001). Jackson was also admitted into the National Museum of Dance and Hall of Fame, making him the first and currently, only recording artist to be inducted. He was also admitted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame. Jackson was also admitted in 2014 into the Rhythm & Blues Hall of Fame along with his father Joe Jackson. He has two Primetime Emmy Award nominations in 1983 and 1990.

A winner of many awards for his humanitarian efforts (helping people around the world who are in need of food, shelter, education, etc.). Jackson has been awarded by two Presidents of the United States for this.

[[The Little Prince]]

CATEGORIES: 1943 books, Children's books, French literature

The Little Prince (Le Petit Prince) is a children's book by the French author Antoine de Saint-Exupéry. It was first published in the United States in English and French in 1943. It was published in France after Saint-Exupéry went missing in 1944.

The story is about a young prince who visits some planets, including Earth, and thinks about important things in life like friendship and love.

[[Pennsylvania House of Representatives]]

CATEGORIES: State lower houses in the United States, Pennsylvania

The Pennsylvania House of Representatives is the lower house of the Pennsylvania General Assembly. It has 203 seats and is currently controlled by the Republican Party. Each member represents one district and is elected for a two year term. There are no term limits.

[[Pennsylvania State Senate]]

CATEGORIES: State upper houses in the United States, Pennsylvania

The Pennsylvania State Senate is the upper house of the Pennsylvania General Assembly. It has 50 seats and is currently controlled by the Republican Party. Senators are elected for four year terms with no term limits.

[[Simp]]

CATEGORIES: Internet slang

Simp is an internet slang term, usually with a pejorative meaning. It means a person, usually male, who appears to be trying to impress a person too much, usually to a person of the opposite sex. Simps will typically attempt to gain a sexual relationship with the person who they are attempting to impress. The person who the simp is attached to normally will not express the same feelings.

The simp may be seeking, or may be accused of seeking, intimacy or sexual intercourse with his target.  The actions of a simp are called "simping".   "Simping" is similar to the term "stanning" (too much interest in a celebrity). Simping can be done by both men and women.  Targets may include celebrities, politicians, e-girls and e-boys.

Originally, the word "simp" was a shortening of the word "simpleton". Since the 2020s, it has been popularly used as an insult. 

[[Monster House (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 2006 animated movies, 2000s supernatural movies, 2006 comedy movies, 2006 horror movies, American animated movies, American supernatural movies, American comedy movies, American horror movies

|editing=
